details.author: Ethganz - Ethnet and Arroganz-
details.description:
[center][color=#b6b6b6][u]Warning[/u][i]: This will make Feral Ghouls a much more challenging encounter. What's that, your into that? Well shit, okay then[/i][/color]


[i][img]https://i.imgur.com/GvUq15I.png[/img][/i]

[font=Tahoma][size=3]Adds several new creatures to flush out Feral Ghouls, as opposed to the occasional Bloated or Gangrenous you see at high level playthroughs. From unique forms of fodder, to creatures with completely new abilities, this is bound to appeal to almost every play type. Custom sounds, models, and textures were used to give them as unique of an identity as possible (Thank you to everyone who let me use their textures/meshes, love y'all!). As opposed to seeing them as "Feral Ghouls", I would like for you to look at this faction as "Ferals" from now on, as now there are more than just brainless potato looking zombies populating it. If you've ever played Left 4 Dead or Back 4 Blood, this is the gameplay I had in mind.﻿

[/size][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=3]Also some are gibbable, and everyone is VATS compatible.[/size][/font]

[u][font=Tahoma]Video Showcase (Credits to TheBeanbagGamer for recording this awesome footage):[/font][/u]

[youtube]_KJSr_HB00o[/youtube]

[size=6]
[font=Tahoma]Juicehead Showcase[/font]

[youtube]zBFCylAjC8E[/youtube]

[font=Tahoma]> [url=https://bethesda.net/en/mods/fallout4/mod-detail/4258998]﻿XBOX Rerelease Now Available Here[/url] <﻿[/font]
[/size]
[font=Tahoma]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/oW4Hly0.png[/img]﻿
[size=4]
When degeneration occurred within normal feral ghouls, their brains became rotted to the point of extreme aggression and appetite. However, in tandem with the different levels of radiation the host was exposed to, and the physical attributes of the host's themselves, different variations and permutations were seen among the Feral Ghoulification process. Some for example, were exposed to so much radiation that they started excreting it in a form of a vile stench, a miracle that they are still alive. Other hosts that were built larger than the average person, mutated in a way that would secure their role a predator by becoming much larger than the average Feral. The rest is history.[/size]

[size=3]Also adds a new drop to all Ferals, "Bile", that can be used to craft one new weapon (for now, bound to be expanded in the future). Other than that, I recommend plugging this badboy in and playing it, as that is the way I personally found it best to learn about it.[/size]

[size=3]If you really need more info, I have included a full dissertation on the new abominations I currently have running around in your game below.[/size]

[size=3]Happy Hunting![/size]

[size=3][img]https://i.imgur.com/MlNSxzL.png[/img]
[spoiler]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/LmOGp44.png[/img]
[b]Name[/b]: Feral Shambler
[b]Enemy Type[/b]: Normal
[b]Added in[/b]: V1.0
[b]Pain in the Ass level making[/b]: 9/10﻿
[/size]﻿
Creatures that are stuck in limbo between turning truely Feral or remaining somewhat human as a ghoul. Slow, but numerous and resilient. They also fancy hair physics and tons of clothing variations, hence why they took 3 lifetimes to make. A special armored variant will begin spawning at level 35.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/GRzMZTC.png[/img]﻿
﻿[size=3][b]Name[/b]: Feral Exploder
[b]Enemy Type[/b]: Special
[b]Added in[/b]: V1.0
[b]Pain in the Ass level making[/b]: 10/10﻿
[/size]﻿
Abominable creatures that serve one purpose in their wretched lives: to die. Upon death, they will begin leaking Bile and all this build-up will lead up to a violent explosion of it. If found in a horde, they are a great ammo saver. Took me freaking forever to find out how to make a convincing aftermath for the explosion of these fellas.

[u]In-Depth Mechanic Explanation:[/u] When you kill one of these fellas will a firearm, they will only explode if the finishing shot was dealth to their front belly. Otherwise, they will not trigger a Bile Explosion. However, their corpses will remain volatile. You could theoretically create a minefield from Exploder corpses. A better concept of what I'm saying can be seen in the Videos Tab demonstration.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/g9AKvSX.png[/img]﻿
﻿﻿[size=3][b]Name[/b]: Feral Spitter
[b]Enemy Type[/b]: Ranged
[b]Added in[/b]: V1.0
[b]Pain in the Ass level making[/b]: 3/10﻿
[/size]﻿
Creatures that have built up enough bile in their lungs in order to spit it out toward enemies. They are very weak up close and can generally be easily dispatched. A special and harder variant will spawn at higher levels (30).

[img]https://i.imgur.com/xwcpvoP.png[/img]﻿﻿
﻿﻿[size=3][b]Name[/b]: Feral Slasher
[b]Enemy Type[/b]: Normal
[b]Added in[/b]: V1.0
[b]Pain in the Ass level making[/b]: 6/10﻿
[/size]﻿
Covered in scatches, these are the most horrific looking of their mutation but also do not lack the intelligence. In fact, they can be seen wielding melee weapons and wearing human armor, something that normal Ferals lack the brains to do. They cause heavy stagger and minor bleed in order to make you easier to feed toward the rest of the Horde. Had to painstakingly bone weapons to this guy's forearm for weapon variety, took more off my life than I needed.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/qqPf1lM.png[/img]
[size=3][b]Name[/b]: Feral Rotter
[b]Enemy Type[/b]: Special
[b]Added in[/b]: V1.0
[b]Pain in the Ass level making[/b]: 10/10﻿
[/size]﻿
Seen with old, moldy, and rotting flesh, these creatures distinguish themselves from the rest of the Horde due to their tendency to stink. Real bad. Upon entering combat, they will begin to emit a radioactive stink that most creatures will eventually die too, including you if you are ill equipped. Can be seen brandishing gasmasks on their faces, which baffled me days on end on how to get working. Stupid CK.

﻿[img]https://i.imgur.com/g1G7NJz.png[/img]
[size=3][b]Name[/b]: Feral Crawler
[b]Enemy Type[/b]: Normal
[b]Added in[/b]: V1.0
[b]Pain in the Ass level making[/b]: 3/10﻿
[/size]﻿
Ferals that decided quadrupedal hunting was best for speed and mobility when chasing down prey. This makes them slippery bastards in combat but are otherwise dealt with using conventional means. Making them crawl was hard, very hard. A special invisible hunter variation will begin spawning at higher levels (35).

﻿[img]https://i.imgur.com/6vFEGhF.png[/img]
﻿[size=3][b]Name[/b]: Feral Tank
[b]Enemy Type[/b]: Heavy
[b]Added in[/b]: V1.0
[b]Pain in the Ass level making[/b]: 4/10﻿
[/size]
A Feral that devolved from a high-muscle human, they look seemingly Blind. Don't be fooled. These are the most dangerous of all the Feral variations as of far and they can easily kill teams of highly equipped militia. Their weakness is being outnumbered, bombarded with heavy weaponry, or simply being too big to fit under a low-rise roof.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/yfwMjni.png[/img]
[size=3][b]Name[/b]: Feral Shambler (female variation)
[b]Enemy Type[/b]: Normal
[b]Added in[/b]: V1.4
[b]Pain in the Ass level making[/b]: 4/10﻿
[/size]﻿
Same difference as normal shamblers. Just the opposite gender.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/w43Rzve.png[/img]
﻿[size=3][b]Name[/b]: Feral Brute
[b]Enemy Type[/b]: Heavy
[b]Added in[/b]: V1.4
[b]Pain in the Ass level making[/b]: 8/10﻿
[/size]
They may look like muscle-brain dummies, but they are a force to be reckoned with. They pose high defensive and offensive stats, and their fists are enough to cause major crippling in creatures smaller than itself. They are also quite fast, but their strokes are easy to dodge. For Honor Centurion meets Feral Ghoul!﻿﻿
[/spoiler]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/h1nXdbI.png[/img]
Use a mod manager﻿ to install, as I have provided an installer with both options on how the Ferals are injected into the game's lists.

[b][i]Requires[/i] Far Harbor[/b]

[b][u][size=5]Compatibility[/size][/u][/b]

[size=3]Compatible with [/size][i]almost everything[/i][size=3], if [/size][b]using the script injected version it is also compatible with Oynlen's More Feral Ghouls[/b][size=3]. Fully compatible with Feral retextures but I would discourage retextures and sound mods because mine already come with their own set.[/size]

[size=3]Also [/size][b]compatible[/b][size=3] with the following:[/size]

[size=3]- [/size][b]Zombie Walkers[/b][size=3] and More Feral Ghouls. Users have reported best results when my plugin is placed [i]below [/i]the aforementioned.

[/size]- FROST ([url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/57358?tab=description]Patch Available[/url]﻿ , kudos to RedMetalShield)

[size=3]- [/size][b]D.E.C.A.Y[/b][size=3] (Patch available)

[/size]- Whispering Hills and / or GRIM

- Unique NPCs

[size=3]- Any other retexture, sound mod...[/size]

[size=3]- Also[/size][b] fully compatible with the FallEvil series[/b][size=3] of mods, because why the hell would I make my mod conflict with my friend's superior ones!?[/size]

[b][u][size=5]Recommended

[/size][/u][/b][size=5][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/52449]Feral Nights[/url]﻿

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/17626]Endless Warfare

[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/37957/]Worldwide Ghouls[/url]﻿
[/size]
[size=3][img]https://i.imgur.com/NheJCwP.png[/img]﻿[/size]
[color=#dd7e6b][size=5][u]When posting a bug or issue, [i]please state which version of the mod you're using[/i], ie. version number and either script or hard injected versions respectively.[/u][/size]
[/color]
[spoiler]
- Not all creatures have dismemberment yet. This is a very hard process to go through with every monster so not sure if it will ever come to fruition
- Slasher's weapons don't dismember properly with the limb, as it is impossible to add segment data to weapons in Outfit Studio
- Currently doesn't work with Toounx's Flashbang mod, until she makes a guide on how to add custom races to the flashbang script this is unfortunately one drawback.

Things on the horizon for updates:
- More items used by Bile
- Loadscreen tips for each creature

There's bound to be more bugs, please let me know so I can get them stomped out in a patch!
[/spoiler]
﻿
[img]https://i.imgur.com/mWGHIvL.png[/img]
[spoiler]There's a lot here, and for good reason! This mod is a massive conglomeration of many amazing works by several different people. I recommend reading through this and seeing just how much work isn't mine alone.

CK, FO4EDIT, Outfit Studio, NifSkope, and Blender were the main tools used to get custom models rigged

MASSIVE thanks to Oynlen for teaching me so much about weighting and creature nuances! You are the best!﻿

GRIM and Whispering Hills: many of their already existing creatures were used as a reference in order to create mine. Thank you both L00ping and Mangaclub!

Thumblesteen for the DECAY textures used by the Rotters

jacksmangina for the Horde Feral Textures

mattesp89 for his Horrific Ghouls Textures

TheJesterofEvil for Better Feral Ghouls Textures

Ghouls Revamped by Fuse00 used by Shamblers

SketchFab artist models for the Spitter and Feral Tank: DJMaesen and KIFIR respectively

SketchFab artists for the Bile containers and grenades: Blender3D and Jiao Silva respectively

Gasmasks for rotter: blenderist
[/font]
VALVE for Left 4 Dead, many sounds used throughout

RedMetalShield for the FROST Patch

and of course, you :')

(IF YOURE READING THIS AND I FORGOT YOU PLEASE SEND MY DUMBASS A MESSAGE)
[/spoiler]


[i]If you feel generous, buy us a Ko-fi! :][/i]
[url=https://ko-fi.com/ethnet][img]https://i.imgur.com/e7H8O9Z.png[/img][/url]﻿﻿[/center]

fileInfo.changelog_html:
Fixed no scripts being in the script folder for the script-injected version. How can I be this incompetent?!?
Fixed flag on the Tank Tweak, reverted to regular ESP
Fixed some instances of rogue 10K textures. File size should decrease, theoretically
Adjusted bone weighting near the jawline of the Female Shambler
Adjusted all hair positions of Female Shambler hair
Total rework of the scripts regarding exploder deaths. They will now instantly explode upon reaching 0 HP, and will no longer leave behind buggy and sussy "corpses". Dead exploders will now change their skin in order to give proper feedback that they are dead, which also now means that they are lootable. There is a better explanation in the Bestiary as well as a demonstration video in the videos tab.
Fixed Crawler head gore being an anglerfish instead of a normal head.
Tweaked and standardized several race attributes
Hopefully addressed Radroach spawning instead of a variant
Tank Body Part data tweaked to be slightly less squishy
Tank damage decreased across the board
Added patch for Feral Nights
Added Ghoul Spawns to Far Harbor
fileInfo.description:
Added spawns to Far Harbor, as well as a plethora of bug fixes, rebalances, mesh tweaks, among other things. New Exploder mechanic Rework, experimental but overall [i]much[/i] less janky. Now lootable!
[youtube]g5PJHTaxcKs[/youtube]
fileInfo.name: FGEP - Main File

modInfo.author: Ethganz - Ethnet and Arroganz-
modInfo.description:
[center][color=#b6b6b6][u]Warning[/u][i]: This will make Feral Ghouls a much more challenging encounter. What's that, your into that? Well shit, okay then[/i][/color]


[i][img]https://i.imgur.com/GvUq15I.png[/img][/i]

[font=Tahoma][size=3]Adds several new creatures to flush out Feral Ghouls, as opposed to the occasional Bloated or Gangrenous you see at high level playthroughs. From unique forms of fodder, to creatures with completely new abilities, this is bound to appeal to almost every play type. Custom sounds, models, and textures were used to give them as unique of an identity as possible (Thank you to everyone who let me use their textures/meshes, love y'all!). As opposed to seeing them as "Feral Ghouls", I would like for you to look at this faction as "Ferals" from now on, as now there are more than just brainless potato looking zombies populating it. If you've ever played Left 4 Dead or Back 4 Blood, this is the gameplay I had in mind.﻿

modInfo.summary: Starting the new year off strong. Adds more than seven new creatures to the Feral Ghoul faction that makes them much more challenging but funner to fight.

B1D4T-KM5.localPath: Vortex Extension Update - Developer Tools v1.0.0.7z

modInfo.author: Nexus Mods
modInfo.description:
[b][size=4]Description[/size][/b]

This extension adds a button to the global menu in the top right of Vortex to open the chrome developer tools.

[b][size=4]Who is this for
[/size][/b]
This can be useful if you try to write a theme for Vortex and need to identify controls. It can also be very useful to help us find bugs or performance problems.

[b][size=4]Compatibility
[/size][/b]
Should be compatible with all versions of Vortex.

[b][size=4]How to install
[/size][/b]
Open the extensions tab in vortex (requires advanced mode) and drag the 7z file onto the drop zone at the bottom.
modInfo.name: Developer Tools
modInfo.summary: Adds a button to Vortex to open the chrome developer tools.

BJZMTbtM9.localPath: Vortex Extension Update - File Preview with WinMerge v1.0.0.7z

details.author: Tannin42
details.description: Requires Vortex >=1.2.13

fileInfo.description: Requires Vortex >=1.2.13
fileInfo.name: Preview with WinMerge

modInfo.author: Tannin
modInfo.description:
[b][size=3]Description[/size][/b]

With this extension installed, when you click "Preview" on a file conflict, it will open the two files in WinMerge to give you a direct comparison between the two.
WinMerge ([url=https://winmerge.org/]https://winmerge.org/[/url]) has to be installed (duh!).
If WinMerge is installed in a non-default location you have to set the correct path in Settings->Tools.
You can also use other visual diff tools as long as they support the same command line parameters (listing the files to compare as the only parameters), Beyond Compare ([url=https://scootersoftware.com/]https://scootersoftware.com/[/url]) works great as well.

[b][size=3]Installation[/size][/b]

This extension requires Vortex >1.2.13. You can install it by going to Extensions->Find more and there look for "Preview WinMerge"
modInfo.name: File Preview with WinMerge
modInfo.summary: Vortex extensions for file previews using WinMerge (and similar diff tools.)

fileInfo.name: UnityModManager

modInfo.author: newman55
modInfo.description:
This tool allows you to use mods in games that do not officially support modding.

[b][size=3]How it works[/size][/b]
Unity mod manager is divided into two parts: installer and mod loader that works inside a game.
The Installer applies a patch to game files and copies additional files to game folder allowing the UMM to run with a game.
When you launch game, the manager loads all mods from 'Mods' folder, will automatically opens the UMM UI, and you can use [b]CTRL+F10[/b] to close or open it again.
Mod manager can't automatically download mods, but can check for updates if you don’t block it with a firewall.

[color=#dd7e6b][size=3]This is an unofficial support for mods and a game developer is not responsible for this mods. Also, do not send bug reports to game developers if you have installed any mods, since errors can cause mods, not a game.[/size][/color]

[b][size=3]How to Install[/size][/b]
[list=1]
[*]Download the UnityModManager.zip file
[*]Extract the archive (e.g. to desktop, do not copy it to the game folder.) and run UnityModManager.exe (recommended to run as administrator)
[*]If the program does not open, try to install [url=https://dotnet.microsoft.com/download/dotnet-framework-runtime/]Net Framework 4[/url]﻿﻿, otherwise go to next
[*]Select a game from the list. If game folder is not automatically detected, select it yourself (e.g. \Steam\steamapps\common\YourGame\)          (the path should contain only english letters)
[*]Select installation method (DoorstopProxy is preferred if available. Assembly is more reliable, but it stops working after updates.)
[*]Click on the install button
[/list]
[size=3][b]How to Install﻿ (Console version)[/b][/size]
[list=1]
[*]Run console.exe
[*]Select a game from the list
[*]Enter path to the game
[*]Select install command and installation method﻿﻿

[/list]
[youtube]82JD8inkq5A[/youtube]

[b][size=3]If [b][size=3]installed[/size][/b] as Assembly method
[/size][/b][list]
[*]Any game update can remove UMM from the game. In this case, you need to click the Install button again.
[*]If you have game from [b]GOG[/b], before updating the game, click on the button "Restore original game files". Otherwise, the update may not be installed.
[/list]
[b][size=3]How to Uninstall[/size][/b]
[list=1]
[*]Click Uninstall button.
[*]Click Restore original files (if available).
[/list]
[b][size=3]How to Install Mods[/size][/b]
[list=1]
[*]Download the mod
[*]Extract the archive and put the mod folder into 'Mods' in game folder or via UMM Mods tab.
[*]Run the game
[/list]
[b][size=3]Linux and Mac[/size][/b]
[list]
[*]Download and install [url=https://www.mono-project.com/download/stable/]mono[/url]﻿
[*]For linux run "mono UnityModManager.exe".  
[*]For mac 32 bit run "mono32 UnityModManager.exe". (doesn't support mono64)
[*]For mac 64 bit run "mono console.exe﻿"﻿
[*]Select Game/Folder then Assembly installation method. Click on the install button.
[*]If you have game path with a dot, you need to make [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/6947826-unity-mod-manager/page-51#entry74459818]symlink[/url]﻿﻿.  Example, ls -s /home/user/.steam/ /home/user/steam. Otherwise folder is not displayed.
[*]If the font is not displayed, for wine need to install [url=https://github.com/newman55/unity-mod-manager/issues/88#issuecomment-1025973371]winetricks allfonts[/url].
[/list]
[b][size=3]Supported games (not working for Windows Store)[/size][/b]
[list]
[*]Oxygen Not Included [color=#e06666](umm 0.21.8 or less)[/color]
[*]Two Point Hospital
[*]Pathfinder: Kingmaker
[*]Car Mechanic Simulator 2018
[*]Garden Paws [color=#e06666](only support 1.3.1 or less)[/color]
[*]Farm Together
[*]Skater XL
[*]My Time At Portia
[*]Dawn of Man
[*]Derail Valley
[*]Eastshade
[*]Factory Town
[*]Motorsport Manager
[*]Added Ultimate Fishing Simulator game.
[*]Monster Sanctuary
[*]Deep Sky Derelicts
[*]Pine
[*]Freeman Guerrilla Warfare
[*]Starcom Nexus
[*]Metal Unit
[*]Banner of the Maid
[*]ATOM RPG
[*]Green Hell
[*]Skul: The Hero Slayer
[*]The Escapists 2
[*]Pillars of Eternity II: Deadfire
[*]Tyranny
[*]People Playground
[*]Executive Assault 2
[*]Raft
[*]Autonauts
[*]Hue
[*]Automation Empire
[*]Stranded Deep
[*]Planet Explorers
[*]Warden: Melody of the Undergrowth
[*]Monster Crown
[*]Swag and Sorcery
[*]Desperados III
[*]Phasmophobia
[*]BMX Streets Pipe
[*]A Dance of Fire and Ice
[*]Phoenotopia Awakening Demo
[*]Solasta
[*]Disco Elysium
[*]Dyson Sphere Program
[*]Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous
[*]Absolute Drift
[*]Broforce
[/list]
[b]Additionally[/b]
[list]
[*][b][url=https://wiki.nexusmods.com/index.php/Category:Unity_Mod_Manager]Wiki[/url][/b]
[*][b][url=https://github.com/newman55/unity-mod-manager/]Source code[/url][/b]
[/list]

details.author: SKK50
details.description:
[size=3]If the player is not safe at a defended workshop during the night, large packs of feral ghoul hunters will chase the player from dusk 'till dawn. [/size]


[color=#980000][size=5][b][center]THE NIGHTS ARE DARK AND FULL OF FERALS[/center][/b][/size][/color]
[size=3]
During the 10 hours of darkness between 8 pm to 6 am, if the player is not in owned workshop build area that has a defense rating, there is an increasing chance throughout the night that a large pack of feral ghouls will chase the player. 
[/size]
[size=3]The player is given an [[color=#00ff00].SKK Feral Nights Holotape[/color]] anytime after Vault 111 exit to adjust settings and start the timers. Craft missing or spares at Chemlab/Utility.
[/size]
[size=3]
Spawning [ Enabled | [color=#00ff00]*Disabled[/color] ] 

Test for spawn every [ 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, [color=#00ff00]*Random[/color] ] game hours at night.

Spawn base chance [ 25%, 50%, 75%, 100%, [color=#00ff00]*Random[/color] ] for the first test.

Spawn chance increments [ 0%, 5%, *10%, 15%, 20%, 25%, [color=#00ff00]*Random[/color] ] after every failed test.

Spawn [ 8, 16, 24, 32, [color=#00ff00]*Random[/color] ] feral hunters.

Live actors loaded cap [ 64, [color=#00ff00]*96[/color], 128 ] use 64 on Xbox, 96 on PC, 128 if your brave downtown.

Feral hunters are [ 50%:Easy, 75%:Medium, [color=#00ff00]*100%:Normal[/color], 125%:Hard, 150%:Boss ] relative to player.

Spawn in interiors [ [color=#00ff00]*On[/color] | Off ] excludes small interiors.

Spawn in worldspaces [ [color=#00ff00]*On[/color] | Off ] to protect Diamond City, GoodNeighbor, Nuka Market traders.

Innocent actor protection [ Off | [color=#00ff00]*On[/color] ] so feral hunters ignore everyone except the player and team mates.

Daylight despawn  [ Off | [color=#00ff00]*On[/color] ] to force cleanup any active actors at dawn (just after 06:00 am).

Warnings [ Off | [color=#00ff00]*On[/color] ] to show or hide day/night reminders and a spawn warning beep.

Workshop safe defense rating [ 5, [color=#00ff00]*10[/color], 20, 40, 80 ]

Workshop max build area safe radius [ 1024, 2048, [color=#00ff00]*4096[/color], 8192 ] game units.


If the holotape does not offer the specific values you need, use the console to set any value you want. 

An optional [[color=#00ff00] Feral Boss Proximity Detector [/color]] can be crafted at Chemlab/Utility. Equip in the grenade slot for audible range warning on an active pack boss. If you are travelling at night with difficult settings you really Really REALLY want one of these equipped.

By default ferals spawn regardless if the player is in an interior, scene, combat, crafting, sleeping, waiting. ANYWHERE. Except at a safe workshop, in small interiors or flying in a Vertibird. It is supposed to be punishing, like snakes on a 'plane.


[b]Detail Operator Notes[/b]

[spoiler]
Using the holotape to [[color=#00ff00] >>> SUBMIT [/color]] changes (or call the SwitchEnabled function from console) will cleanup any active spawn and reset spawn test timers.

Whilst most SKK spawning mods use real time intervals for finer control, to simplify day/night calculations this uses game hours. At default 20:1 Timescale, one game hour is only 3 real minutes. If you run low Timescale settings you may want to use lower game hour intervals for action. 

Even with no other actors to manage, the game engine can not manage to path more than 32 actors with AI movement packages that track a moving target like the player. Any more actors just get left behind, so that is a hard cap for this solution no matter how much hardware, memory or script extenders you have. The limit is processing TIME.

The solution detects the number of live actors in the active area to either cap spawn count or skip spawning if the game has to manage more than [ [color=#00ff00]Live Actors Loaded Cap[/color] ]. The downtown areas most affected (until they are cleared between cell resets):

TheaterHub360Ext 118
FaneuilHallExt 93
Financial21Ext 90
GoodneighborExt 87
MassFusionExt 82

Things that will cause a spawn timer test to fail and either hold or start a new timer cycle: It is no longer night, Player is OnMount (Vertibird or riding some mod device), Player is in an interior cell that is too small or with that setting disabled, Player is in an enclosed worldspace with that setting disabled, There are too many live actors already in the area, The chance is less than 100 and the random roll fails, The player is in a safe workshop radius.

If the player manages to run far enough away from a live pack that they unload 3d (around 15,000 game units) they are cleaned up to (a) reward that tactic and (b) fix actors that have spawned stuck on roofs & such, (c) avoid spawn bloat so the test timer can restart. Trying to get away by fast travel or hopping through a load door ... see what happens ;)

With the volume of actors this spawns, the number of legendaries generated in survival is insane so ChanceLegendary is temporarily set to zero during actor spawning to help reduce that cheesing. Although occasional legendaries still manage to spawn, no idea how that happens with a zero chance set. 

Innocent actor protection is not 100% effective. Some existing world actors are set to Very Aggressive hostility or have "Aggro Radius" enabled on their AI, both of which cause them to engage neutral actors like feral hunters. D-OH ! 

If you are serious about non OP experiences and running away or maintaining separation is a tactic, it would be best to not use companions as their AI does not understand those options so they stand and engage to be mobbed to bleedout/death. The SKK philosophy is that any game the player can just tank trough and does not need to run away from is not worth playing (and why [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/52049]Frog Legs[/url] is now in Fallout 4).

Feral actors are standard base game LvlFeralGhoulGlowingOne boss and LvlFeralGhoul followers. They can be swapped out for other actors by xEditing FormList SKK_FeralNightsActors. Index 0 is the boss which is spawned once, index 1 is for all other followers that make up the numbers. Do not add more actors.[/size]
[size=3][/spoiler]

[/size]
[size=3][b]Compatibility[/b]
[/size]
[size=3]This can be installed at any time in any game, it does not need a new game if your save is stable (ho, ho, ho).
[/size]
[size=3]The mod has no dependencies on extenders or DLCs and does not change any existing base game scripts, assets or objects. It is 100% pure new Creation Kit forms and scripts which means that it has no load order dependencies.
[/size]
[size=3]As this mod was published after November 2019 it depends on Fallout4.exe 1.10.162.0 (or later). 

Ghoul related content that users have reported it works with: True Storms, Zombie Walkers, Night of the Creeps, Feral After Dark, Fallout 4-76 Feral World.

[/size]
[b][size=3]Known Issues[/size]
[/b][size=3]
(1) DO NOT USE THIS if you are using a solution that replaces ferals, such as SKK Feral Replacement System or Replace Any Actor. That would be beyond stupid.

[/size]
[size=3][b]Nexus PC manual installation & disable[/b]
[/size]
[size=3]Copy SKKFeralNights.esp and  SKKFeralNights – Main.BA2 to your ...\Fallout 4\Data directory and add to Plugins.txt, or enable in the Bethesda mod menu, use a mod manger or however you organise. When the mod is disabled in the holotape and the detector is unequipped it is totally inactive with no scripts running. [/size][size=3]Only remove mods if you are happy to accept potential conflicts from load order changes in a save game.

[/size]
[size=3][b]Nexus FAQ[/b]
[/size]
[size=3](1) Why is there no ESL version ? Because life already contains sufficient hassle maintaining 50 scripted ESP solutions. 

(2) Is this just a dumbed down Combat Stalkers that just renames ferals to hunters at night ? No totally not. Combat Stalkers is a scalpel that delivers an elegant combat experience with a maximum of 8 ~ 16 actors (whilst consuming the minimum script time possible). Feral nights is supposed to be blunt trauma kick in the head with 32 ferals chasing the player at top speed (whilst consuming the minimum script time possible).
[/size]
[size=3](3) Is this compatible with X, Y or Z ? If its an SKK mod that does not replace ferals then YES, else I have no idea. As it makes no changes to anything it should not conflict, but if you have concerns then you need to test them.

[/size]
[size=3][b]Console Settings[/b]
[/size]
[font=Courier New]set SKK_FeralNightsSpawningEnabled to 1
; [0|1] to disable/enable spawning.

set SKK_FeralNightsSpawnTimerGameHours to 3
; [-1 | 0.1 to 9] how often to check for ferals at night. -1 is random, over 9 hours will never complete during the night.

set SKK_FeralNightsSpawnChanceBase to 50
; [-1 | 1 to 100] as a percent value. -1 is reandom. Do not set zero.

set SKK_FeralNightsSpawnChanceIncrement to 10
; [-1 | 0 to 100] as a percent value added to the base for every failed random roll on timer. -1 is random.

set SKK_FeralNightsSpawnCount to 16
; [-1 | 1 to 32] -1 is random.

set SKK_FeralNightsLiveActorCap to 96
; [32 to 128] limits the feral spawn so the TOTAL number of live actors in the active area does not crash the game. Setting less than 32 or more than 128 has no effect as they are the hard hard limits. The base game has up to 118 live actors in the active area downtown which helps to bugger your frame rates.

set SKK_FeralNightsSpawnDifficulty to 4
; [0|1|2|3|4] Actor health 0:Easy, 1:Medium, 2:Hard, 3:Boss, 4:PlayerLevel

set SKK_FeralNightsSpawnInInterior to 1
; [0|1] disable/enable spawning in interior cells larger than 3000 game units (minimum smapn distance).

set SKK_FeralNightsSpawnInWorldspace to 1
; [0|1] disable/enable spawning in DiamondCity, Goodneighbor, NukaMarket. 

set SKK_FeralNightsInnocentProtection to 1
; [0|1] disable/enable feral hunters ignoring everyone except the player and team mates.

set SKK_FeralNightsDaylightDespawn to 1
; [0|1] disable/enable despawning of active feral hunters just after 06:00 dawn.

set SKKFeralNightsWarningsEnabled to 1 
; [0|1] disabled/enable day/nign reminders and spawn warning beep.

set SKK_FeralNightsWorkshopSafeDefense to 10
; [0 to 999] minimum value to qualify an owned workshop as safe from ferals.

set SKK_FeralNightsWorkshopSafeRadius to 4096
; [0 to 10240] maximum game units distance from a qualifying workshop to be safe in larger build areas. 

set SKK_FeralNightsDisableLegendary to 1
; [0|1] disable/enable legendary actor spawns (not 100% effective, so call it reduce).

To reset the spawn chance and timer to current settings or cleanup spawns, call function
cqf SKK_FeralNightsQuest "SKK_FeralNightsQuestScript.SwitchEnabled"



[/font][size=3][i][center]This solution was inspired by [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/34304850-1ae0bfb8/]1ae0bfb8[/url] sharing quality observations using Fallout 4-76 feral world as the base platform for an Omega Man survival run. Just add snappable junk fences and recruitable workshop Protectrons.[/center][/i][/size]
[size=3][center]********************************************************************************************
SKK mods for Fallout4 will no longer be maintained on nexusmods.com from July 2021
 
If you have read the comprehensive solution description and still need support, use the [url=https://discord.gg/tgKNT77DC8]SKK Mods Discord channel[/url]﻿ https://discord.gg/tgKNT77DC8

If you are looking for an SKK solution that has been removed from this site to respect the author's IP, or would like to stay up to date with other content, you can find it on [url=http://skkmods.com/]SKKMods.com[/url]﻿ http://skkmods.com[b]
[/b]
[b]SKK solutions are provided as-is for personal use only. No commercial use, monetization, re-use, packaging, re-packaging or distribution of SKK created code/scripts in whole or in part is allowed.
© 2021 skk.50@outlook.com all rights reserved.
[/b]********************************************************************************************[/center][/size]

fileInfo.changelog_html:
UPDATE NOTES: this update is transparent, can install in an active savegame.
New: Holotape option to Enable/Disable warnings SKK_FeralNightsWarningsEnabled default enabled.
fileInfo.description: If nexus offered mod authors a simple mod pack opt-in one way trapdoor of "This mod is available to include in modpacks (but archives would have to be kept for it to work) YES|NO", there would be no problem.

; [-1 | 0.1 to 9] how often to check for ferals at night. -1 is random, over 9 hours will never complete during the night.

; [-1 | 1 to 100] as a percent value. -1 is reandom. Do not set zero.

set SKK_FeralNightsSpawnChanceIncrement to 10
; [-1 | 0 to 100] as a percent value added to the base for every failed random roll on timer. -1 is random.

set SKK_FeralNightsSpawnCount to 16
; [-1 | 1 to 32] -1 is random.

set SKK_FeralNightsLiveActorCap to 96
; [32 to 128] limits the feral spawn so the TOTAL number of live actors in the active area does not crash the game. Setting less than 32 or more than 128 has no effect as they are the hard hard limits. The base game has up to 118 live actors in the active area downtown which helps to bugger your frame rates.

set SKK_FeralNightsSpawnDifficulty to 4
; [0|1|2|3|4] Actor health 0:Easy, 1:Medium, 2:Hard, 3:Boss, 4:PlayerLevel

set SKK_FeralNightsSpawnInInterior to 1
; [0|1] disable/enable spawning in interior cells larger than 3000 game units (minimum smapn distance).

set SKK_FeralNightsSpawnInWorldspace to 1
; [0|1] disable/enable spawning in DiamondCity, Goodneighbor, NukaMarket. 

set SKK_FeralNightsInnocentProtection to 1
; [0|1] disable/enable feral hunters ignoring everyone except the player and team mates.

set SKK_FeralNightsDaylightDespawn to 1
; [0|1] disable/enable despawning of active feral hunters just after 06:00 dawn.

set SKKFeralNightsWarningsEnabled to 1 
; [0|1] disabled/enable day/nign reminders and spawn warning beep.

set SKK_FeralNightsWorkshopSafeDefense to 10
; [0 to 999] minimum value to qualify an owned workshop as safe from ferals.

set SKK_FeralNightsWorkshopSafeRadius to 4096
; [0 to 10240] maximum game units distance from a qualifying workshop to be safe in larger build areas. 

set SKK_FeralNightsDisableLegendary to 1
; [0|1] disable/enable legendary actor spawns (not 100% effective, so call it reduce).

To reset the spawn chance and timer to current settings or cleanup spawns, call function
cqf SKK_FeralNightsQuest "SKK_FeralNightsQuestScript.SwitchEnabled"



[/font][size=3][i][center]This solution was inspired by [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/34304850-1ae0bfb8/]1ae0bfb8[/url] sharing quality observations using Fallout 4-76 feral world as the base platform for an Omega Man survival run. Just add snappable junk fences and recruitable workshop Protectrons.[/center][/i][/size]
[size=3][center]********************************************************************************************
SKK mods for Fallout4 will no longer be maintained on nexusmods.com from July 2021
 
If you have read the comprehensive solution description and still need support, use the [url=https://discord.gg/tgKNT77DC8]SKK Mods Discord channel[/url]﻿ https://discord.gg/tgKNT77DC8

If you are looking for an SKK solution that has been removed from this site to respect the author's IP, or would like to stay up to date with other content, you can find it on [url=http://skkmods.com/]SKKMods.com[/url]﻿ http://skkmods.com[b]
[/b]
[b]SKK solutions are provided as-is for personal use only. No commercial use, monetization, re-use, packaging, re-packaging or distribution of SKK created code/scripts in whole or in part is allowed.
© 2021 skk.50@outlook.com all rights reserved.
[/b]********************************************************************************************[/center][/size]

fileInfo.changelog_html:
Fixed bug where finished downloads were not being installed when importing the data a second time (only affected non-premium users)
Added allowAutoEnable property to generated data - users importing said data will have the mods auto enabled after import

fileInfo.description: Needs Vortex 1.3.x or higher
fileInfo.name: dependency-fulfiller

modInfo.author: Nagev
modInfo.description:
[b][size=4][size=4][b]Important Notes:

[/b][/size][size=3]This extension is experimental and although it has been tested, some bugs may still be present - the extension is a personal project and is [b]NOT [/b]an official Nexus Mods extension, please report any issues you encounter on this extension page - please avoid reporting them through the internal feedback system.[/size]

What is this/How does it work ?

[/size][/b][size=3]This is an experimental Vortex extension which aims to give users the ability to automatically fulfill mod dependencies and/or share mod setups with other Vortex users. This extension allows users to "Export Dependencies" by selecting one or more mods from the mods table (Only mods downloaded through the Nexus Mods website are supported), Vortex will generate a JSON string containing all the information required to download the mods - this data can then be distributed to other users by standard copy-paste - the other users will then need to "Import Dependencies" through the action bar button in the mods page. (view gifs in image gallery)

Alternatively mod authors can distribute a generated dependency file with their mods which will immediately attempt to fulfill mod dependencies on successful mod installation (if the user enables this functionality in their settings page). The "Import Dependencies" button on the mods page can also be used to tell Vortex to search for dependency files within the current game's staging folder and attempt to fulfill them that way (for those of us that prefer full control over when the fulfillment system kicks in)

Although premium membership is highly recommended (mod download and installation is triggered automatically without any further input from the user), Non-Premium members can still benefit from this extension - Vortex will open a tab for each mod file's download page.

Example data:[/size]
[code][
  {
"archiveName": "BuildShare-5-1-4-0c-1614288309.zip",
"downloadIds": {
"fileId": 442,
"gameId": "valheim",
"modId": 5
},
"allowAutoInstall": true,
﻿"rules": []
  },
  {
"archiveName": "Better Continents-446-0-4-1-1616286717.zip",
"downloadIds": {
"fileId": 2343,
"gameId": "valheim",
"modId": 446
},
"allowAutoInstall": true,
﻿"rules": []
  }
]
[/code][size=4]
[b]What it doesn't do:

[/b][/size][list]
[*][size=3]Will not export mods sourced outside of NexusMods.com[/size]
[*][size=3]Will not export mods with orphaned/missing download archives[/size]
[*][size=3]Will not export manually added mods unless the mod's metadata is populated (use the "Guess Id" buttons to have Vortex identify your mod and pull the metadata for you)[/size]
[*][size=3]The auto-fulfill on install functionality will not use requirements defined within the mod page! (for auto-fulfill to work, the mod needs to have a ".vdeps" file included by the mod author)[/size]
[/list]
[b][size=4]How to install:[/size][/b]

[list]
[*][size=3]Find the "Dependency Fulfiller" extension inside Vortex's extensions page and install it from there. (If it's missing, refresh the extensions list manually or wait for Vortex to update it and try again)[/size]
[*][size=3]Clicking the "Vortex" button on this mod/extension page should open up the extensions page with the Dependency Fulfiller pre-selected - (again, if it doesn't show up or Vortex says it's unavailable - refresh the extensions list or wait for Vortex to refresh it)[/size]
[*][size=3](Not recommended) you can install the extension manually by downloading the archive and extracting it in your "%appdata%/vortex/plugins" folder. Please be aware that Vortex will not be able to automatically update the extension if you choose this method[/size]
[/list][size=3]
[/size][b][size=4]Feedback:[/size][/b]

[size=3]If you have a suggestion or an issue you would like to discuss please feel free to post on this project's github page [url=https://github.com/IDCs/dependency-fulfiller/issues]https://github.com/IDCs/dependency-fulfiller/issues[/url]﻿[/size]
modInfo.name: Mod Dependency Fulfiller
modInfo.summary: Provides an easy way to quickly share/download/install mod setups between different Vortex instances

modInfo.author: Ruddy88
modInfo.description:
[color=#d5a6bd][size=6][b][u]Ruddy88 Simple Sorter[/u][/b][/size][/color]


[color=#d5a6bd][size=2][b]VERSION HISTORY:
[/b][/size][/color][color=#d8d8d8][size=2][i]See Changelog tab for detailed info
[/i]
[font=Arial][i]0.5 BETA - Initial public release
0.6 BETA - Blank Name bug fix and various improvements (XML and SCRIPT)
0.7 BETA - Critical bug fixes. All reported major bugs now resolved.
0.8 BETA - Added a "Skip WEAP/ARMO" option. Added a new category to Weightless Options for MISC (Mods Only). Added a BAT file to the FO4Edit directory for more convenient patching. (See POSTS section for 0.8 Patch Notes).
0.81 BETA - Script file hotfix to remove component tags from Valuables and other non scrap tagged items.
Updated DEF_INV_TABS.xml to better categorise Barter and Trade menus.[/i][/font][/size]
[size=2]
[/size][/color]
[size=2][color=#d5a6bd][b]DISCLAIMER:[/b]
[/color][color=#d8d8d8]This mod does not install or run like typical mods. As such, I have included a very extensive set of instructions. Do not let it scare you off, this mod is very simple to use for what it does. But please, ensure you read through each section before you report any issues. I know, walls of text suck, but it's necessary for mods like this. Just read it.[/color]

[color=#d5a6bd][b]INTRODUCTION:[/b]
[/color][color=#d8d8d8]Welcome to Ruddy88's Simple Sorter.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]This is an XEdit script that allows users to AUTOMATICALLY patch their entire load order for use with DEFUI's icon tag replacement feature.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]For those that dont know what that means, DEFUI is a mod that uses text replacement to add icons to items. There is also an added benefit of the text replacement still being used in alphabetical sorting so you get better categorisation of items making navigating your pipboy much easier.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]If that still doesnt make sense: It adds icons to inventory items and allows for better sorting.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]Traditionally though, for mods to utilise DEFUIs icons, you would need countless patches to add the required text tag to the item names.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]This is where Simple Sorter comes in.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Simple Sorter is a FO4Edit script that will automatically add the text needed for icon replacements for all valid items in your entire load order. It automatically scans your mod list, loads all valid items to a new ESP, then detects what sort of item it is so that the correct icons are used.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]This means NO MORE endless patches and NO MORE spending hours of manually editing mods. There's a few steps to get it started, but after that its a simple process of just running the script to generate a patch.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]I have also included some item rollups to further clean up your pipboy menus. Virtually every item has been split in to sub groups that are accessed via the pipboy. EG: Your weapons tab wont be full of all sorts of weapons, instead it will display Melee, Ranged and Explosives. You can click on any of these to see all the relevant weapons of that type rather than have all 3 types on one page.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]A final note, I have added as many "safety" features as I can to this mod. This mod is to be used INSTEAD of things like VIS or VIS-G, so you shouldnt have those mods installed, however, for those that are lazy, you dont necessarily have to remove all your old VIS versions of mods, as this mods script will REMOVE any tags before adding new ones.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]The exception to this is INNRs, but I am working on a way to effectively clean them up a bit.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Either way, uninstall VIS or VIS-G prior to using this mod but dont worry too much about VIS versions of other mods. [/color]


[color=#d5a6bd][b]REQUIREMENTS:[/b]
[/color][i]The following mods are a hard requirement.
DO NOT try and install all of these with a mod manager, many will require manual installation (See INSTALLING REQUIRED FILES).
[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8]FO4Edit  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737/]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737/[/url]
[color=#d8d8d8]MXPF  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68617/]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68617/[/url][color=#d8d8d8]  (Yes, this is a Skyrim mod, it works on FO4)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]DefUI  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10654]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10654[/url]
[color=#d8d8d8]DEF_UI Iconlibs Rescaled and Fixed  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/31088/]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/31088/[/url][color=#d8d8d8]  (Colored or Monotone, your choice).[/color]

[u]OPTIONAL
[/u][color=#d8d8d8]HUDFramework  -  https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/20309/  (If using the additional component tags)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]AKWCR  -  https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6091/  (If using the AWKCR workbench patcher)[/color]


[b][color=#d5a6bd]SHORT VERSION:
[/color][/b][color=#d8d8d8]Below this section is a very in depth guide on how to set this mod up. [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]For those who are a little more comfortable with Patching takes time, for me it takes about 15 mins to run on a mod list of about [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]210 plugins, it all depends on the size of you scripts, here's a very vague rundown.[/color]

[list]
[*]﻿Install all required mods, make sure MXPF and R88SimpleSorter_SCRIPT are both extracted to your FO4Edit directory.
[*]﻿Run FO4Edit, ﻿during plugin selection, leave it as default (loads with all curently active plugins). Hold SHIFT when hitting OK to load the progam faster.
[*]When loaded, right click any plugin from the left hand panel, select Apply Script, navigate to R88_SimpleSorter and hit OK.
[*]Select your options from the popup dialogue box, mouse-over for tool tips for more explanation.
[*]Select NEW Patch to generate a patch for the first time or to "nuke" your old patch and start over.
[*]Select "Amend" to re-run the patch but only patch in newly added records (This doesn't always work well, Suggest running a new patch each time).
[*]Name the new plugin whatever you want, just dont ever change the author name in the header.
[*]When finished, make any manual tweaks, close FO4Edit to save your new plugin.
[*]Remember to activate the new plugin in your mod manager.
[/list]

[color=#d8d8d8]For those wanting a more in depth guide, keep reading.[/color]


[b][color=#d5a6bd]INSTALLING REQUIRED FILES:[/color]
[/b][/size]1. Download FO4Edit manually, extract contents to a directory of your choice.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]2. Download MXPF manually (it is hosted on Skyrim Nexus), extract contents to your FO4Edit directory, ensuring the 'Edit Scripts' folder aligns with      the one in FO4Edit.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]3. Download my R88SimpleSorter_SCRIPT file manually, as above, extract to FO4Edit directory ensuring Edit Scripts folders line up.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]4. Download DEFUI, both main files. Users who have already installed DEFUI will not need to reinstall it providing they chose both DEF_INV during      their installation. You can reinstall it if you wish to choose different options.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]5. Install with Mod Manager of your choice with the following options:[font=Verdana][size=2][b]
[/b] ﻿ ﻿a. Select both DEF_INV and DEF_HUD.
﻿ ﻿b. Select a language and a screen ratio.
﻿ ﻿c. OPTIONAL: Select "Use Sorting Mod Component Tags" (requires HUDFramework).
﻿d. ﻿Select "Vanilla HUD".
﻿ e. Choose to include basic XML files (this is just to fill in any missing files that my mod doesnt include).
[/size][/font]6. When you are done with the first file, install the second file (translations), Delete the Translate_xx.txt file from Fallout 4\Data\Interface folder.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]7. Downlaod and install DEF_UI Iconlibs Rescaled and Fixed with a mod manager of your choice. Let it overwrite.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]8. Download and install my R88SimpleSorter_XML file with a mod manager of your choice. Let it overwrite.[font=Verdana][size=2]


[i]OPTIONAL[/i][color=#d8d8d8]: If you chose "Use Sorting Components" when installing DEFUI, then you will also want to download and install HUDFramework using a mod manager of your choice.[/color]

[i]OPTIONAL[/i][color=#d8d8d8]: Download and install my R88SimpleSorter_INNR with a mod manager of your choice, This ESP should be last in your load order prior to running the script (next section).[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]This is a simple esp that re-orders the vanilla dynamic naming records. It DOES NOT add any text tags for icon replacement, that is all handled via the script in the next section. You can choose to use my INNR format, or stick with the vanilla ones. You CAN use other mods INNRs if you wish, but you may end up with double text tags in some cases.[/color]


[b][color=#d5a6bd]PATCHING:
[/color][/b][i]NOTE: Patching takes time, expect anywhere between 5-30 mins for it to run, depending on how extensive your mod list is.
It is also strongly suggested to sort the rest of your mod list before attempting to patch, so get any smashed/bashed patches, merged plugins and load order all sorted before running the script.

0.8+ Users:
I have now included a BAT file in the main SCRIPT archive.
Simply navigate to your FO4Edit directory and double click the R88SimpleSorter.BAT file.
This will auto-run FO4Edit with your currently active mods and will auto run the Simple Sorter patch for you. 
You will still be prompted with the same patch options. You can now skip to step 3 to read more about them.
Also remember to activate your new plugin in your mod manager when you are done.
[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8]1. Open FO4Edit, a dialogue window will display all your plugins. Click OK, this will load the program with all your currently active plugins pre-selected. [/color][i]NOTE: Hold shift for a few seconds as you press OK, this does a faster load of the program.[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8]When the message window shows: Background Loader: finished, the program has fully loaded.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]2. In the left hand panel, right click any of the listed plugins, select "Apply Script".[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Navigate to R88_SimpleSorter. [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]DO NOT edit the text box. Simply click OK to run the script.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]3. In the first dialogue box, you will be presented with some options:[/color]

[list]
[*][b]Run AWKCR Workbench Patcher[/b]: This will detect any item recipes that use the CHEMS workbench, if the created item is a weapon, armor, ammo, or explosive, then it will instead be added to the appropriate AWKCR workbench under the "Other" category.
[*][b]Weightless Items[/b]: This will make all selected item types have 0 weight. If you select this option, then you will be prompted in a second screen which item types to include.
[*][b]Simpler Armor Sorting[/b]: This simplifies "Armor" and "Clothes" categories in to just "Armor". This is because it is often hard to automatically distinguish between the two and items risk being mis-categorized (like a hat being labelled as armor).
[*][b]Use Scrap Item Component Tags[/b]: This adds additional text replacement tags to the end of SCRAP items. If using HUDFramework and DEF_HUD, these text tags are hidden but will be displayed as a list of components when you mouse-over on scrap items in the world.
[*][b]0.8+ | Skip Armo/Weap Patching: [/b]This bypasses any WEAP/ARMO/INNR/LVLI patching for those who wish to use another sorting mod like VIS to handle weapon and armors. See the sticky in the POSTS section on this mod page for more information.
[*][b]0.8+ | Value:Weight Ratio:[/b] Simple Sorter adds a [Valuable] tag to your scrap/junk misc items that have a value:weight ratio of 50 or more (items with less than 1 weight are treated as 1). You can now set this ratio to whatever you want. NOTE: If you use the Weightless options, the value:Weight ratio will be applied afterward so all items will be treated as if they were weight 1.
[/list]
[color=#d8d8d8]4. Select "New Patch" if this is your first time running the script OR if you want to nuke the old patch and start fresh.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]If prompted for a name, you can name it whatever you want (Just don't change the Author Name in the plugins File Header).[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]VERY IMPORTANT: Patching takes time, BE PATIENT. Report any patch times in excess of 15 mins.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]FO4Edit has a tendency to "freeze" and show as not responding, this is normal, just leave it, go make a coffee, and wait it out.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]When the patcher is done you will get a popup message saying "Patching Complete". [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]I have included an Amend button that lets you run the patch for newly added items to your mod list without messing with the items already patched. However, it doesn't always work well, especially on larger load orders. When possible, you are better off selecting NEW PATCH, though doing this WILL nuke the old patch items, so you will lose any manual edits you made to the patch.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]5. When you are done, it is suggested to have a quick look through the new patch plugin and look for any miscategorised items and make any manual edits if you are comfortable with FO4Edit. If you are finding items that are wildly miscategorised, or entire mods that get put in the wrong categories, please let me know and I will decide whether its feasible to alter the script or not.
[/color][color=#efefef]NOTE: For 0.8+ users using the BAT file to patch, you will not be able to inspect the plugin after patching. Instead you will have to close FO4Edit, then reopen it the normal way and be sure to select your patch in the plugin selection menu.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]6. Close FO4Edit, upon doing so you will receive a popup box, make sure your new plugin is selected and continue exiting. Your plugin will now be saved. Again, FO4Edit can freeze up at this point as it is writing a lot of data, give it a few mins to close completely. [/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]7. Load up your mod manager, make sure the new patch ESP is located AT THE BOTTOM of your load order, no exceptions, and remember to activate the ESP in your mod manager.[/color]


[color=#d8d8d8]That should be all there is to it. These steps are quite detailed, and make it seem like a huge task to patch your game but its actually very simple to do, I just like to be thorough.[/color]


[color=#d5a6bd][b]NOTES:[/b][/color]
[list]
[*]Do not re-run the patch in the same session of FO4Edit, always resart FO4Edit before re-running the script a second time. There is a GUI glitch that sometimes occurs where your new plugin disappears from the list. It is still there it just doesnt display.
You will still be prompted to save it on closing but its better to avoid the bug anyway.[*]Do not change the AUTHOR name on your newly made plugin, the script uses this to determine if an existing patch has been made. You can change the actual NAME of the plugin though.
[*]INNR Dynamic Naming patching is incredibly difficult to get right, as there is numerous ways an item can be renamed. In some cases, the script may not catch every item so you might see cases where an item doesnt have an icon. If this happens, report it to me so I can investigate, in the meantime you can rename items at workbenches, DEFUI will still use any valid text replacement tags this way. See below for a list of all the text tags used.
[*]Patching takes time, for me it takes about 15 mins to run on a mod list of about 210 plugins, it all depends on the size of your mod lists and what sort of items you have in your game. BE PATIENT.
FO4Edit has a tendency to "freeze" and show as not responding, this is normal, just leave it, go make a coffee, and wait it out. When the patcher is done you will get a popup message saying "Patching Complete". [/list]
[i][b]
This mod has a LOT of moving parts under the hood, that it would take too long to explain every little detail. That said, It is all stuff that is happening outside of the game so there is effectively no performance hit.[/b][/i]

[b][color=#d5a6bd]CATEGORIES:[/color]
[/b][color=#d8d8d8]These are the categories/tags used by this mod. You can rename weapons and armor and still type the relevant text tag and DEFUI will [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]still use the relevant icon.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8][Aid][/color]
[color=#d8d8d8](Stimpak)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8][Device][/color]
[color=#d8d8d8](Food)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8](RadFood)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8][Drink][/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]{Chem}[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]{Liquor}[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]{Syringer}[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8](Ammo)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8](Ranged)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8](Melee)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8][Grenade][/color]
[color=#d8d8d8][Mine][/color]
[color=#d8d8d8][Armor][/color]
[color=#d8d8d8][Clothes][/color]
[color=#d8d8d8](Vaultsuit)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8][PowerArmor][/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]{Non-Human}[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]|Scrap|[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8](Currency)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8](Lockpick)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8](Valuable)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8](Collectible)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8][Perk: Bobblehead][/color]
[color=#d8d8d8][Perk: Mag][/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]{Mod}[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8](Pipboy)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8](Camping)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8][Game][/color]

modInfo.name: Ruddy88's Simple Sorter
modInfo.summary: Simple Sorter is a FO4Edit script that will automatically add the text needed for icon replacements for all valid items in your entire load order. It automatically scans your mod list, loads all valid items to a new ESP, then detects what sort of item it is so that the correct icons are used. No more patches, no more manually patching.

fileInfo.name: Vortex Showcase Extended

modInfo.author: agc93
modInfo.description:
This extension is still in preview, please report any issues you find! 

[size=4]What is it?[/size]

This is a simple extension that adds a number of alternative formats to Showcase, allowing you to create more specialised showcases and share them more easily. These new formats integrate neatly and easily into Vortex Showcase so there's no additional steps.

There's plenty more information on what is and isn't available in [url=https://showcase.vortex.support/]the Showcase docs[/url], especially [url=https://showcase.vortex.support/docs/introduction/faq]the FAQ[/url].

[size=4]How to use it?[/size]

You can install the extension directly from Vortex's Extensions pane, or from the CI builds on GitHub. Restart Vortex and you should be good to go.

You can then create showcases just as you normally would (from either the top bar or action bar with mods selected) and choose any of the new formats in the dialog. You can then copy/save/share your showcase like usual.

Please report any bugs or issues you find as I have only been able to complete some basic (and limited) testing with this extension so far.

---

[i]Disclaimer[/i]: This project is not associated with Nexus Mods
modInfo.name: Vortex Showcase - Extended Formats
modInfo.summary: An extension for Vortex Showcase that adds a handful of additional formats that you can use to share your mods including CSV, Discord and a more compact Markdown format.

fileInfo.name: Bayonetta Extension

modInfo.author: CbBara
modInfo.description:
[center][color=#b6b6b6]For the time being, this extension is still a work in progress[/color][/center]

[color=#ffff00][size=4][center][i] [u]How to install and set up everything for modding[/u][/i][/center][/size][/color]
[color=#f1c232][color=#fff2cc][size=4]Once the extension is installed immediately do this to avoid any issue [/size][/color][/color]
[color=#f6b26b]Go to settings[/color], then the[color=#f6b26b] MODS tab[/color] and it should look like this, place the Mod Staging Folder (where mods will be located) in the same drive where Bayonetta is located (I recommend to install bayonetta in another drive instead of the main Drive to avoid issues like crashing if it is open through steam)
[img]https://i.postimg.cc/YqZFZww8/3254.png[/img][center]
[color=#ffff00][size=4]You are ready to start modding.[/size][/color][/center][color=#ffff00][size=4]
 [/size][/color]
[size=3][color=#ff7700][center]﻿[/center][color=#f6b26b][size=3]In case of conflicts like this, where two mods have the same files, use only ONE MOD, never both at the same time. (Currently working on this issue)[/size][/color]
[/color][/size][color=#ffff00]1.[/color]
[img]https://i.postimg.cc/wvYpxnj5/conflicts.png[/img]
[color=#ffff00]2. [color=#fff2cc](Hopefully the next update will prevent users of using this method of resolving conflicts, since Bayonetta is not a bethesda game duh, there's no load order just one file (or multiple) per costume)[/color][/color]
[img]https://i.postimg.cc/pTWRqyG7/conflicts.png[/img]
[color=#00ffff][size=4]Mods working with the vortex extension are :[/size][/color]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/mods/23?tab=files]Bayonetta Music Mod (completely)
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/mods/32]Custom Bayonetta 2 Themed UI and minor edits (not completely, it seems its an issue with the extension not recognizing subfolders, currently working on it)
[/url][color=#fce5cd]
[/color][size=3][center][color=#ffff00][size=5][u][i][color=#fce5cd]Section only for modders [/color][/i][/u][/size][/color][/center][/size][color=#ffff00]READ THE [i][u]INDIVIDUAL COSTUMES[/u][/i] section (even if you are not a modder) because almost all mods from the Bayonetta nexus page need to be updated with a specific structure or else the mods won't work (you will need to manually extract and put the folders into a zip, 7zip or rar file if you want the mod to even work)[/color]
[size=3]

[i]If you want to create your own fomod for Bayonetta[/i][/size]
 
Follow this guide [url=https://wiki.nexusmods.com/index.php/How_to_create_mod_installers]How to create mod installers[/url]

Here's an example of how I made the structure of the [color=#ffff00][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6821/?tab=files]FOMOD[/url][/color](this is the tool) base on this [color=#f4f4f4][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/mods/35]two[/url][/color] [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/mods/34?tab=files]mods[/url] from [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/users/93473883]creativehandler[/url] and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/users/100080168]cookieman301[/url]:[url=https://postimg.cc/gallery/kRnPXQk] [color=#ffff00][size=4][size=3]https://postimg.cc/gallery/kRnPXQk [/size]
[/size][/color][/url][color=#cfe2f3][color=#f6b26b][size=3]If you want to open a FOMOD, open the tool and go to the dropdown menu and click on the FOMOD menu or tab (?) and open folder, select in this case A Witch With No Memories and The Famed Witch (+Extras) and it should give you an example on how to set a your own FOMOD[/size][/color]
[color=#ffe599][color=#00ffff]Note[/color]: If a [color=#00ffff]group (main folder-example-)[/color] contains more than three [color=#00ffff]plugins (subfolders[color=#cfe2f3][color=#ffe599][color=#00ffff]-example-[/color][/color][/color])[/color] set priorities from 1, 2, 3 and 4 and so on until you reach the last plugin or the first plugin wont be recognized by Vortex regardless of the "Selection" options you put[/color][/color]

-Once opened the tool, go the info tag and read the instructions to know what
does what (also be careful to not use some symbols and other stuff like
ñ or ´ when naming the folders or files, if you are familiar with
coding or programing you know what I mean)

-Don't bother with Flag Set, Conditions, Plugin Dependencies, Required Installation or
Conditional installations UNLESS ABSOLUTLY necessary, for example if you
have manage to create a new way to mod Bayonetta then yes (exaggerating
but you get the idea), by all means (which will force me to update the extension and yeah...)

[center][size=4][i][u][color=#ffff00]Individual costumes[/color][/u][/i]
[/size][/center]
[color=#00ff00]For example in case you are only replacing one costume with no variations, the folder structure has to ALWAYS[color=#b6d7a8] (for now, until I discover a way to make the extension place the files in the proper folder regardless of the mod structure)[/color] be like this [color=#b6d7a8](yes, inside the 7z file can go the wp, se, et, id or any other folder as long as it follows the structure below[/color][/color])
[img]https://i.postimg.cc/c4y4GB4G/Proper-Folder-Structure.png[/img]

Some resources for modders (is not mine)

[url=https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1G_nSHwJez5N2w1aCI7mwiV6IF1DMP76FmSQKqjSKz3A/edit#gid=165438385]https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1G_nSHwJez5N2w1aCI7mwiV6IF1DMP76FmSQKqjSKz3A/edit#gid=165438385
[/url][url=https://discord.com/invite/P6FdwFK]


[/url]
Changes to be made:

[list]
[*]Make the extension recognizce subfolders inside the mods
[*]If two mods contains the same files, make the user choose only one, not both.
[*]Make the extension recognize file names and put them inside their respective folders without the need of a folder structure
[/list]
