fileInfo.name: Import from Steam Workshop

modInfo.author: Pickysaurus
modInfo.description:
This extension is currently in beta and may include bugs. Please report any problems you encounter. I have only tested this with Steam Workshop for Skyrim 2011. 

You can select which mods to import, then you will be prompted to unsubscribe from the workshop versions before the process completes. Vortex will offer you handy buttons to open each workshop page. If for some reason Steam falls out of whack and doesn't uninstall the mods properly you will need to manually delete the files from your workshop folder. 

Once mods have been import to Vortex they will no longer be updated when the Steam Workshop entry updates. You also cannot reinstall the mods as no archive is created (possible improvement).

I've gone all in with games, just to see how robust it is. Remember, this is very much a beta extension. Currently supports importing from:
[code]﻿['skyrim', 'ahatintime', 'enderal', 'darkestdungeon', 'dawnofman', 'divinityoriginalsin2', 'divinityoriginalsin2definitiveedition', 'faleanniversary', 'galacticcivilisations3', 'kenshi', 'kerbalspaceprogram', 'legendofgrimrock', 'mbwarband', 'neverwinternightsenhancededition', 'oxygennotincluded', 'payday2', 'pillarsofeternity2deadfire', 'portal2', 'prisonarchitect', 'rimworld', 'x4foundations', 'xcom2' ];
[/code]

[b]Vortex Install
[/b]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, enabled advanced mode in the settings.
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Manual Install
[/b]
Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins\steam-import
modInfo.name: Import from Steam Workshop
modInfo.summary: Import mods installed via Steam Workshop into Vortex

fileInfo.changelog_html:
Added new feature: Automatic output file partitioning - Completely overhauled the patch output file building process. All records are deep-analysed to determine their real required masters. Then an optimized output patch plan will be created. The plan also distribute records automatically to multiple files, if necessery. This should prevent the master-limit-reached problem completely.
Added new feature: Automatic tag injection via keywords in INNR. (Prevents things like "White [Helm] Helmet")
Added new feature: Record scripts - Apply advanced record modification through the new TagIdent "SPECIAL:RecordScript:...".
Added new feature: INNR scripting - Now you can completeley modify an INNR to anything you like (move/delete/rename entries, add/remove keywords and add whole new rulesets/entries)
Added new feature: Grouped batch processing by task groups. Allows multiple processing lines (prefilter+processing) to be executed independend and parallel.
Added special plugin "Item Sorter Tags", which allows to disable whole item tagging (for those who just want use the other patch plugins)
Added new plugin: ECO/Armor Clothing Overhaul Patcher - Patches records for use with ECO/ACO.
Added new plugin: ECO/Crafting Framework Workbench Patcher - Moving recipes to the Crafting Framework stations
Added new plugin: Immersive Animation Framework Patcher - Add animation via keywords to ingestibles.
Added new plugin: PANPC Patcher - Excludes various NPC from PANPC scripting to save ressources.
Added new plugin: Perk Magazine Numbers - Add #numbers to perk magazines names, like "Grognak the Barbarian #09".
Added mod rules for ECO, Project Mojave, Modern Firearms and Modern Armors
Added new rule capability: Allow multiple SPECIAL-TagIdents (functions) in one rule, seperated by comma.
Added new condition compare operation "hasKeyword"
Added new condition special identifier "SPECIAL:WinningOverrideESP" (analog to SPECIAL:MasterESP)
Added warning for sorter patch files in record history
Added new optional plugin properties: requiredRecordTypes and requiredFiles- Mark required record types and required plugin files
Change increased plugin processing speed (Especially for the ones with many options)
Change default for pre-filter is is now IGNORE instead of KEEP
Fixed Nuka DLC's "Rifle Rifle" and double subtitle "Western Revolver"
Change separated tag configuration as own optional file, so it can be directly installed by a Mod Organizer.
fileInfo.description:
FallUI Item Sorter - Tag configuration
FallUI Item Sorter Version: 1.13
(Contains no ESP - As you will build your own with Complex Sorter)
(Note: Don't use if you want to create VISG, Ruddy88 or Horizon item sorting patches with CS)
fileInfo.name: FallUI Item Sorter - Tag Configuration

modInfo.author: m8r98a4f2
modInfo.description:
[color=#e69138][size=5][b]M8r98a4f2's Complex Sorter[/b][/size][/color]

[i]The Complex Sorter from FallUI Item Sorter Mod. Automatically add item tags to all items. Highly versatile and completely configurable: custom processing rules, custom tag sets, custom naming rules. You can just change anything to your liking. Standard rules support most custom mods out-of-the-box.[/i]

I have build the Complex Sorter for the prepared Item Sort shipped with FallUI. And a few users asked for the script. So here it is! It has grown in the meanwhile... Now you can customize just anything. Just take a look at the screenshots.

[color=#b6b6b6](Uses parts of Ruddy88's Simple Sorter - Usage permission is granted by Ruddy88. Uses MXPF library by Mator, usage is granted via MXPF license)[/color]

[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Usage as player[/b][/size][/color]
Add Item Sorting tags to all items in all mods (vanilla and downloaded). You don't need endless item sorting patch files anymore, just [b]one for all[/b].
The default configuration will create an ESP exactly like the ones in the "[i]FallUI Item Sorter Mod[/i]" packages, but with all your items from all your mods!
Just lean back and let the script do the work.

[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Usage as mod author[/b][/size][/color]
It also allows you to create specific patch files for any mod(s) you like, which you can upload to Nexusmods. This allows you to create ready-to-use files for players which don't use FO4Edit. You can also automate steps with the processing rules, which elsewhere must be done manually.
In fact: All FallUI Item Sorter Mod pre-built EPSs are created with Complex Sorter without any manual ESP editing!

[color=#e69138][size=4][b]A warning[/b][/size][/color]
If F04Edit is unknown to you and you haven't the intention to learn a bit more about Fallout 4's modding, this mod is probably nothing for you.
It is intended for FO4Edit users. This script is highly automated, but you still need to start it.
If you just want a ready-to-go package, you find many pre-built packages on the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/49656/?tab=files]FallUI Item Sorter Mod[/url] page.

[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Features[/b][/size][/color][spoiler]﻿[list]
[*]All the good stuff you know from Ruddy88's Simple Sorter
[list]
[*]Automatically tags all items in your loaded ESPs, creating a patched ESP with all items in your game configuration
[*]Can be re-executed for a new mod setup at any time
[*]Automatic added components tags
[/list][*]Language independent (Uses your game language for all your generated files - Including automatic translation of Ruddy88s INNR rules)
[*][b]Complete customizable dynamic processing rules[/b] - You can change everything, starting by the filter conditions, over the classification rules till the final tag set.
[list]
[*]Allows easy adding of individual custom-mod processing rules. If the automatic detection miss some items - just add a processing rule to fix it!
[*]Included graphical Processing Rules Editor with new-rule-assistant.  Just click together your perfect tagging!
[*]You can define rules globally for all records or just for one specific mod. The rules are processed in an easy intuitive order: First the mod specific, then the global ones. Additionally all rules you define have higher priority than the standard rules, so you can adjust everything to fit your mod list.
[/list][*][b]PLUGINS[/b]
[list]
[*]Plugins can change nearly everything from just injecting processing rules to modifying records field by a complex control script.
[*]The plugins have own user settings, that you simple define in one line in your plugin file. The setting is then available to the user in the main GUI. Available settings types: bool, int, float, string
[*]Plugins can have complex scripting, which allows to perform nearly any possible action on the record. For more details please look at the topic "Documentation: Plugin system" on this page.
[*] Plugins are defined as INI files. Most F04-users know the ini basics, so even non-programmers can perform simpler changes by them-self.
[/list][*]Adds a wide range of weapon type tags automatically to vanilla and custom mod weapons. Supports multiple methods to cover all possible namings: Injecting in INDR-INNR record, writing item name in record and writing item name in unique item templates.
[*]Adds many apparel tags based on damage resistance and body part coverage just by the standard rule set. Also adds more ammunition classification tags and more misc item tags.
[*]Includes rules for all vanilla weapon item tags. Complete tagging for all Fallout 4 items and most custom mods.
[*]Injects heuristic INNR rules to custom mods for precise item tagging
[*]Automatic detection of weapon type through heuristic classification rules, allowing to tag custom mod weapon correctly
[*]Supports multiple output tag sets like FallUI, Ruddy88's or VIS-G tag set. You can also create your own custom tag set (via tags.ini). The selected output tag set will automatically used by all processing rules. So you can generate appropriate tags for different Item Sorters with just a drop-down change.
[*]All heuristic naming rules and injected INNR rules can be configured. (rules-innr.ini)
[*]Intelligent caching system greatly speed up the processing - especially on the second run. Auto-detect rules and settings changes and renew the cache on-demand.
[*]Fast update-mode - If you just added mods you can just add the missing items. Greatly reduces needed patching time. (Won't work for mod removals)
[*]Save previous selected settings in ini file. This will be pre-selected on next script start.
[*]Multiple setting profiles: Save all Complex Sorter menu settings as a named profile and restore it at any time.
[/list][/spoiler]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Requirements[/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737]FO4Edit[/url]﻿
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/33983]Ruddy88's Simple Sorter[/url] optional file: [i]R88SimpleSorter_INNR[/i][color=#b6b6b6] [/color][color=#b6b6b6](you don't need the main files)[/color]
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Installation[/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*]Install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737]FO4Edit[/url]
[*]Install [i]R88SimpleSorter_INNR[/i] from [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/33983?tab=files]Ruddy88's Simple Sorter optional files[/url]﻿[color=#b6b6b6] (Just the optional one - don't install the main files)
[/color][list]
[*]If you use the ECO mod, which already include the R88-INNRs, you can skip this (CS 1.10 will show a warning but you can ignore it).

[/list]
[*]Copy the Complex Sorter files from this mod's zip folder "[i]FO4Edit\Edit Scripts\[/i]" to your FO4Edit's folder "[i]...\F04Edit\Edit Scripts\[/i]".
[*]Start Complex Sorter via right click on any esp in F04Edit and select "[i]Apply Script[/i]". Then select "[i]M8r_ComplexSorter[/i]".
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Quick start[/b][/size][/color]
Here is a quick start to get your first patch with a 99% item coverage in most cases.
[spoiler]
[b]TL;DR[/b]: Install. Start CS script in FO4Edit. Set your wanted settings in the GUI. Press "Generate Patch".

[b]Quick start step by step
[/b]
[list]
[*][b]1) Preparations[/b]
[list]
[*]Install this mod according to above installation instructions.
[*]Put [i]R88_SimpleSorter.esp[/i] (R88SimpleSorter_INNR in optional section from [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/33983]Ruddy88's Simple Sorter[/url]) to the end of your plugin list.
[*]If you currently use a pre-built FallUI Item Sorter ESP (e.g. [i]M8r_Item_Tags_Vanilla.esp[/i]), uninstall or disable it - You will build your own!
[*]Make sure you have a Item Sorter tag configuration installed. You don't need this for Complex Sorter, but later for the game. For FallUI Item Sorter you can use the optional file on this page or the included tag configuration in the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/48758]FallUI Inventory[/url]﻿ installer.
[/list][*][b]2) Start[/b]
[list]
[*]Start FO4Edit as normal. (If you're using MO2, make sure you run FO4Edit through MO2)
[*]Right-click on any esp in the left list and select "[i]Apply Script[/i]...". Then select "M8r_ComplexSorter" and click OK.
[/list][*][b]3) Generation[/b]
[list]
[*]Watch the "[i]Input ESPs[/i]" list. This defaults to include all mods. If you want some mod to be not processed simply remove it from the list.
[*]Check the plugins for your personal preference (Weightless items, radio tags, quest tags, ...)
[*]Click on "[i]Generate Patch[/i]" and watch the magic
[/list][/list][/spoiler]﻿
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Tips[/b][/size][/color]
[spoiler]﻿[list]
[*]All standard configuration is for FallUI's Item Sorter Mod. So be sure to check the configuration if you like to use it with any other Item Sorting Mod.
[*]Use shift+click for esp selection at F04Edit to greatly speedup start time. (This turn off reference building, which isn't needed for the script)
[*]Add "[i]-nobuildrefs[/i]" to your FO4Edit start arguments to automate that shift-click!
[*]Add "[i]-autoload[/i]" to your FO4Edit start arguments to bypass the first mod selection box (This will load plugins according to your plugins.txt like the game)
[*]Start Complex Sorter with hotkey [i]Ctrl+Y[/i] in F04Edit (Requires one manual start once)
[*]Check the other plugins for your personal preferences (like [Valueable] tag, armor body slots, armor body part tags etc.)
[*]If you like to disable [i]R88_SimpleSorter.esp[/i] afterwards, activate "[i]Include all R88 INNR records[/i]" in advanced options.
[*]If you want weightless items, enable the plugin [i]Weightless Items[/i]. (You can configure its settings too if you like)
[*]If you want radio and station tags, enable the plugin [i]Radio Tags[/i]. For radio tags you also have to enable [i]ACTI [/i]and [i]MESG [/i]record types.
[*]TIP for [url=https://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url]﻿ users: Define item sorting mod ESP as "[i]Dynamic patch[/i]", so it will be sorted to the end automatically!
[*]TIP for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1]Vortex[/url]﻿ users: Go to plugins list. Double click the CS output file. Choose "Dynamic Patches" from the drop down group tab. Now Vortex will sort it automatically at the bottom properly! ﻿(Thanks to shrad1994﻿ for this tip)
[/list][/spoiler]﻿

modInfo.name: M8r98a4f2's Complex Item Sorter
modInfo.summary: The Complex Sorter from FallUI Item Sorter Mod. Automatically add item tags to all items. Highly versatile and completely configurable: custom processing rules, custom tag sets, custom naming rules. You can just change anything to your liking. Standard rules support most custom mods out-of-the-box.

details.author: m8r98a4f2
details.description:
[color=#e69138][size=6][b]MCM Booster[/b][/size][/color]

Reduces the MCM Menu loading time from many seconds (or even minutes) to a fraction of the time (nearly instant). This mod caches the configuration files (json) in a serialized and very fast readable form. Works for any language.


[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Installation[/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*]Install with any Mod Organizer
[/list]
[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Savegame safety[/b][/size][/color]
Absolutely safe. Contains no plugins and does no changes to your savegame. Can be installed/uninstalled at any time.

[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Compatibility[/b][/size][/color]
Incompatible with MainMenu-Interface replacers (containing MainMenu.swf). Simple main menu sound/graphic replacers are compatible.
If you're using a Main-Menu-News-Remover and you DON'T use any CC content, you can use this alternative ini setting for news-removal: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/57041/]Disable Creation Club Completely (Incl. Removing Main Menu News)[/url]

[color=#e69138][size=4][b]Recommendations[/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*]Check out my other MCM extension mod: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/56195]MCM Settings Manager[/url]

[/list]
[b][color=#e69138][size=4]Comparison[/size][/color][/b]

Seeing is believing :) The following videos show the MCM menu with russian translation, which have extreme high loading times.
(Thanks to ChikadoZ for making the both videos for comparison)

[b]Default MCM Loading
[/b]
[youtube]yHJgLvpm4H0[/youtube]

[b]Boosted MCM Loading
[/b]
[youtube]QsatGugZyGY[/youtube]

The Nexus community

fileInfo.name: xEdit Cleaning Extension

modInfo.author: Pickysaurus
modInfo.description:
Integrates an automated plugin cleaning function into Vortex for Gamebyro plugins.

[b]This extension requires [url=https://github.com/TES5Edit/TES5Edit/releases]xEdit by ElminsterAU[/url] to be installed on your PC and defined in the dashboard of your chosen game inside Vortex.
[/b]
In v0.0.1 a new button has been added to the info pane for Gamebyro plugins which will launch xEdit and perform a "quick auto clean" operation on the selected plugin.

A future update may allow the user to right-click a plugin to activate the cleaning function from the context menu, however, this is currently not possible.
[list]
[*]The cleaning option will not appear if the plugin is the primary master file (e.g. Skyrim.esm).
[*]The cleaning option will be disabled if either the plugin has missing masters or there is a LOOT message informing the user not to clean it. In the latter case, you are free to clean it manually, this just disables the automation.
[/list]
Once xEdit has closed, Vortex will show a confirmation of the plugin we attempted to clean.

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/61/61-1572538680-559194572.png[/img]

Currently supports:
[list]
[*]Skyrim
[*]Skyrim SE
[*]Skyrim VR
[*]Fallout 4
[*]Fallout 4 VR
[*]Fallout New Vegas
[*]Oblivion
[*]Fallout 3
[*]Enderal
[*]Fallout 76
[/list]
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/61/61-1573584841-371036160.png[/img]

[b]Vortex Install

[/b][list]
[*]In Vortex, enabled advanced mode in the settings.
[*]Navigate to the extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Manual Install[/b]

Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins.
modInfo.name: xEdit Cleaning Extension
modInfo.summary: A useful extension for Vortex which allows you to use xEdit's "Quick Auto Clean" function on any GameBryo plugins in your load order.

S1mBVMYzc.localPath: Vortex Extension Update - Modlist Backup v0.3.2.7z

modInfo.author: Garethp
modInfo.description:
[b]How do I use this?[/b]
Go to your mods tab and you should see a "Modlist" button in the top menu. If you click on that, you'll see three options: "Modlist Backup: Restore", "Modlist Backup All Games" and "Modlist Backup Only This Game". To back up your mods, click either the "Modlist Backup All Games" or "Modlist backup Only This Game". This will open up a save file window that asks you to open a file, but instead of opening an existing file you want to save to one that doesn't exist yet. Do this by going to the bottom bar where there's a text box for "File name:" and enter a new name. This should be the name of a file that doesn't already exist, and it's where your mod list will be saved. For example, type in "Modlist.txt" or "Mods.json". Then click open. A popup should then ask you if you want to create this file, select yes.

To restore, select "Modlist Backup: Restore", navigate to that file that you saved previously and open it. It will only restore the mods for the currently active game, even if the modlist you created has multiple games in it

[b]Important Note
[/b]A recent version of Vortex fixes a bug that in turn stopped this mod from being able to Restore modlists. If you're unable to restore your modlist, please update this mod to Version 0.3.0 or newer and try again

[b]What does this do?[/b]
This is a very simple extension that takes the list of mods that Vortex currently has and writes them to a file. It then allows you to take that file and Restore your list of mods, making Vortex download them again as if you'd downloaded them from the Nexus Website.

[b]Does this backup Mod Configs, Load Order, Dependencies Etc.
[/b]No, this is a simple and rather dumb extension that [i]just[/i] backs up the list of mods

[b]Does it back up the mod files
[/b]No, this only stores list of mods. When you Restore the list, Vortex will download every mod on the list

[b]Are there any requirements
[/b]You need to be a premium member on the Nexus site to Restore the list, since the Vortex client won't let you download the mods automatically unless you're a premium member, since you need to see the ads.

[b]I have a lot of mods, the extension said they were installed but I don't see anything happening
[/b]Due to how rate limiting on Nexus server works, larger lists of mods it takes some time for all the requests to install to go to the Nexus website. The more mods you have, the more time Vortex puts between each request to the server. Go make a cup of coffee, watch a video, come back later. There's nothing this mod can do to speed it up and I can't tell you how long it will take, but it should be working it's way through to hopefully be adding them to your downloads. If it's not there in half an hour or an hour [b]then[/b] something may be broken and you can ping me directly on Discord or Github and I'll take a look
modInfo.name: Modlist Backup
modInfo.summary: This is a very simple extension that takes the list of mods that Vortex currently has and writes them to a file. It then allows you to take that file and Restore your list of mods, making Vortex download them again as if you'd downloaded them from the Nexus Website.

fileInfo.name: Add Game Wizard

modInfo.author: Tannin
modInfo.description:
[b][size=3]Description[/size][/b]

This extension adds a button to the "Games" page that starts a wizard to add games that aren't currently supported by Vortex.
Please note that while you can add any game to Vortex this way, only games that are trivial to mod (as in: modded files get dumped into a specific game directory) will actually work correctly.
For anything more complex programming will be necessary but the code generated by this extension can still serve as a starting point.

You are welcome to release the game extensions you generate with this wizard, the generated code is free of any license restrictions.

[b][size=3]Installation[/size]
[/b]
This extension requires Vortex >1.3.0. You can install it by going to Extensions->Find more and there look for "Add Game Wizard"

modInfo.summary: Vortex extension to simplify adding new games to Vortex.

Syrn4ftzc.localPath: Vortex Extension Update - Valheim Support v1.0.17.7z

modInfo.author: Nagev
modInfo.description:
This extension adds support for Valheim to Vortex enabling you to install and uninstall mods for the game. 

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/?BH=0&RH_ModList=nav:true,home:false,type:0,user_id:0,game_id:3667,advfilt:true,include_adult:true,page_size:20,show_game_filter:false,open:true,tags_yes%5B%5D:4198]Vbuilds[/url] (pre-made structures/constructions) are also supported, but require [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/5]BuildShare (AdvancedBuilding)[/url] to be installed. Vortex will detect when BuildShare is needed and notify you, after which you can simply install it like any other mod.


[b]New in 1.0.5:[/b]

World Saves can now be installed like any other mod but will require the mod [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/446]Better Continents[/url] - Vortex will notify you of this requirement.

[i]Note on uninstalling/removing new World Saves:[/i]

To remove worlds you will need to disable them in Vortex AND delete them via the ingame menu.

Known issues: due to a bug with the game/synchronisation of files, Valheim will reinstate .old files for World Saves even after they've been deleted when the game is launched and synchronisation in Steam is enabled (default). This is not a Vortex issue and will happen even if new worlds are installed/created manually. This is not a critical bug as it won't do any harm other than take up some extra space on your hard drive.



[b][size=3]How to install[/size][/b]

Simply select "Valheim" from the games list and download the extension through Vortex. (Requires Vortex 1.1.0 or newer).


[b][size=3]If you have mods installed already[/size][/b]

It is recommended to use this extension on a vanilla (unmodded) game installation of Valheim. However, if you have already installed mods using BepInEx or InSlimVML, there should not be any problems as long as you did not manually rename any of the BepInEx/InSlimVML or data folders in your Valheim directory.


[b][size=3]Note on Valheim mods using InSlimVML[/size][/b]

[i]The following does not apply for the vast majority of Valheim mods which use BepInEx (rather than InSlimVML).[/i]

For mods requiring [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/21]InSlimVML[/url], please make sure you download and install it. This process works just like installing any other mod in Vortex. Vortex will notify you if it detects a mod that requires InSlimVML.

For mod authors:

If your mod is a plugin (rather than a vbuild) and needs [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/21]InSlimVML[/url], please give your plugin a name using [b]a _VML suffix[/b]. For example, if your plugin is called MyMod.dll and it requires InSlimVML, please name it [b]MyMod_VML.dll[/b]. Vortex will read the suffix and know the mod needs to be deployed differently than a BepInEx mod.

For users:

If you are using a mod requiring InSlimVML (that is not a vbuild) that does not have the _VML suffix (so the name of the mod plugin is something like MyMod.dll rather than MyMod_VML.dll), you will need to change the modtype in Vortex to ensure the mod is deployed correctly. As of now this is a very rare use case.

To change the modtype:

[list=1]
[*]Open Vortex and select "MODS" in the side menu to bring up your mod list.
[*]Double-click on the mod you want to change.
[*]In the details panel that will pop up on the right side, scroll to the very bottom where you should see a "Mod Type" section with a dropdown.
[*]Select "InSlimVML Mod" from the dropdown.
[*]Deploy your mods (a notification should have been raised) via the notification or by clicking "Deploy Mods" in the toolbar.
[*]That's it! Enjoy your mod!
[/list]
modInfo.name: Valheim Support
modInfo.summary: Adds support for Valheim.

details.author: Ruddy88
details.description:
[color=#d5a6bd][size=6][b][u]Ruddy88 Simple Sorter[/u][/b][/size][/color]


[color=#d5a6bd][size=2][b]VERSION HISTORY:
[/b][/size][/color][color=#d8d8d8][size=2][i]See Changelog tab for detailed info
[/i]
[font=Arial][i]0.5 BETA - Initial public release
0.6 BETA - Blank Name bug fix and various improvements (XML and SCRIPT)
0.7 BETA - Critical bug fixes. All reported major bugs now resolved.
0.8 BETA - Added a "Skip WEAP/ARMO" option. Added a new category to Weightless Options for MISC (Mods Only). Added a BAT file to the FO4Edit directory for more convenient patching. (See POSTS section for 0.8 Patch Notes).
0.81 BETA - Script file hotfix to remove component tags from Valuables and other non scrap tagged items.
Updated DEF_INV_TABS.xml to better categorise Barter and Trade menus.[/i][/font][/size]
[size=2]
[/size][/color]
[size=2][color=#d5a6bd][b]DISCLAIMER:[/b]
[/color][color=#d8d8d8]This mod does not install or run like typical mods. As such, I have included a very extensive set of instructions. Do not let it scare you off, this mod is very simple to use for what it does. But please, ensure you read through each section before you report any issues. I know, walls of text suck, but it's necessary for mods like this. Just read it.[/color]

[color=#d5a6bd][b]INTRODUCTION:[/b]
[/color][color=#d8d8d8]Welcome to Ruddy88's Simple Sorter.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]This is an XEdit script that allows users to AUTOMATICALLY patch their entire load order for use with DEFUI's icon tag replacement feature.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]For those that dont know what that means, DEFUI is a mod that uses text replacement to add icons to items. There is also an added benefit of the text replacement still being used in alphabetical sorting so you get better categorisation of items making navigating your pipboy much easier.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]If that still doesnt make sense: It adds icons to inventory items and allows for better sorting.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]Traditionally though, for mods to utilise DEFUIs icons, you would need countless patches to add the required text tag to the item names.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]This is where Simple Sorter comes in.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Simple Sorter is a FO4Edit script that will automatically add the text needed for icon replacements for all valid items in your entire load order. It automatically scans your mod list, loads all valid items to a new ESP, then detects what sort of item it is so that the correct icons are used.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]This means NO MORE endless patches and NO MORE spending hours of manually editing mods. There's a few steps to get it started, but after that its a simple process of just running the script to generate a patch.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]I have also included some item rollups to further clean up your pipboy menus. Virtually every item has been split in to sub groups that are accessed via the pipboy. EG: Your weapons tab wont be full of all sorts of weapons, instead it will display Melee, Ranged and Explosives. You can click on any of these to see all the relevant weapons of that type rather than have all 3 types on one page.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]A final note, I have added as many "safety" features as I can to this mod. This mod is to be used INSTEAD of things like VIS or VIS-G, so you shouldnt have those mods installed, however, for those that are lazy, you dont necessarily have to remove all your old VIS versions of mods, as this mods script will REMOVE any tags before adding new ones.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]The exception to this is INNRs, but I am working on a way to effectively clean them up a bit.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Either way, uninstall VIS or VIS-G prior to using this mod but dont worry too much about VIS versions of other mods. [/color]


[color=#d5a6bd][b]REQUIREMENTS:[/b]
[/color][i]The following mods are a hard requirement.
DO NOT try and install all of these with a mod manager, many will require manual installation (See INSTALLING REQUIRED FILES).
[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8]FO4Edit  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737/]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737/[/url]
[color=#d8d8d8]MXPF  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68617/]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68617/[/url][color=#d8d8d8]  (Yes, this is a Skyrim mod, it works on FO4)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]DefUI  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10654]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10654[/url]
[color=#d8d8d8]DEF_UI Iconlibs Rescaled and Fixed  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/31088/]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/31088/[/url][color=#d8d8d8]  (Colored or Monotone, your choice).[/color]

[u]OPTIONAL
[/u][color=#d8d8d8]HUDFramework  -  https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/20309/  (If using the additional component tags)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]AKWCR  -  https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6091/  (If using the AWKCR workbench patcher)[/color]


[b][color=#d5a6bd]SHORT VERSION:
[/color][/b][color=#d8d8d8]Below this section is a very in depth guide on how to set this mod up. [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]For those who are a little more comfortable with Patching takes time, for me it takes about 15 mins to run on a mod list of about [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]210 plugins, it all depends on the size of you scripts, here's a very vague rundown.[/color]

[list]
[*]﻿Install all required mods, make sure MXPF and R88SimpleSorter_SCRIPT are both extracted to your FO4Edit directory.
[*]﻿Run FO4Edit, ﻿during plugin selection, leave it as default (loads with all curently active plugins). Hold SHIFT when hitting OK to load the progam faster.
[*]When loaded, right click any plugin from the left hand panel, select Apply Script, navigate to R88_SimpleSorter and hit OK.
[*]Select your options from the popup dialogue box, mouse-over for tool tips for more explanation.
[*]Select NEW Patch to generate a patch for the first time or to "nuke" your old patch and start over.
[*]Select "Amend" to re-run the patch but only patch in newly added records (This doesn't always work well, Suggest running a new patch each time).
[*]Name the new plugin whatever you want, just dont ever change the author name in the header.
[*]When finished, make any manual tweaks, close FO4Edit to save your new plugin.
[*]Remember to activate the new plugin in your mod manager.
[/list]

[color=#d8d8d8]For those wanting a more in depth guide, keep reading.[/color]


[b][color=#d5a6bd]INSTALLING REQUIRED FILES:[/color]
[/b][/size]1. Download FO4Edit manually, extract contents to a directory of your choice.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]2. Download MXPF manually (it is hosted on Skyrim Nexus), extract contents to your FO4Edit directory, ensuring the 'Edit Scripts' folder aligns with      the one in FO4Edit.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]3. Download my R88SimpleSorter_SCRIPT file manually, as above, extract to FO4Edit directory ensuring Edit Scripts folders line up.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]4. Download DEFUI, both main files. Users who have already installed DEFUI will not need to reinstall it providing they chose both DEF_INV during      their installation. You can reinstall it if you wish to choose different options.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]5. Install with Mod Manager of your choice with the following options:[font=Verdana][size=2][b]
[/b] ﻿ ﻿a. Select both DEF_INV and DEF_HUD.
﻿ ﻿b. Select a language and a screen ratio.
﻿ ﻿c. OPTIONAL: Select "Use Sorting Mod Component Tags" (requires HUDFramework).
﻿d. ﻿Select "Vanilla HUD".
﻿ e. Choose to include basic XML files (this is just to fill in any missing files that my mod doesnt include).
[/size][/font]6. When you are done with the first file, install the second file (translations), Delete the Translate_xx.txt file from Fallout 4\Data\Interface folder.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]7. Downlaod and install DEF_UI Iconlibs Rescaled and Fixed with a mod manager of your choice. Let it overwrite.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]8. Download and install my R88SimpleSorter_XML file with a mod manager of your choice. Let it overwrite.[font=Verdana][size=2]


[i]OPTIONAL[/i][color=#d8d8d8]: If you chose "Use Sorting Components" when installing DEFUI, then you will also want to download and install HUDFramework using a mod manager of your choice.[/color]

[i]OPTIONAL[/i][color=#d8d8d8]: Download and install my R88SimpleSorter_INNR with a mod manager of your choice, This ESP should be last in your load order prior to running the script (next section).[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]This is a simple esp that re-orders the vanilla dynamic naming records. It DOES NOT add any text tags for icon replacement, that is all handled via the script in the next section. You can choose to use my INNR format, or stick with the vanilla ones. You CAN use other mods INNRs if you wish, but you may end up with double text tags in some cases.[/color]


[b][color=#d5a6bd]PATCHING:
[/color][/b][i]NOTE: Patching takes time, expect anywhere between 5-30 mins for it to run, depending on how extensive your mod list is.
It is also strongly suggested to sort the rest of your mod list before attempting to patch, so get any smashed/bashed patches, merged plugins and load order all sorted before running the script.

0.8+ Users:
I have now included a BAT file in the main SCRIPT archive.
Simply navigate to your FO4Edit directory and double click the R88SimpleSorter.BAT file.
This will auto-run FO4Edit with your currently active mods and will auto run the Simple Sorter patch for you. 
You will still be prompted with the same patch options. You can now skip to step 3 to read more about them.
Also remember to activate your new plugin in your mod manager when you are done.
[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8]1. Open FO4Edit, a dialogue window will display all your plugins. Click OK, this will load the program with all your currently active plugins pre-selected. [/color][i]NOTE: Hold shift for a few seconds as you press OK, this does a faster load of the program.[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8]When the message window shows: Background Loader: finished, the program has fully loaded.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]2. In the left hand panel, right click any of the listed plugins, select "Apply Script".[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Navigate to R88_SimpleSorter. [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]DO NOT edit the text box. Simply click OK to run the script.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]3. In the first dialogue box, you will be presented with some options:[/color]

[list]
[*][b]Run AWKCR Workbench Patcher[/b]: This will detect any item recipes that use the CHEMS workbench, if the created item is a weapon, armor, ammo, or explosive, then it will instead be added to the appropriate AWKCR workbench under the "Other" category.
[*][b]Weightless Items[/b]: This will make all selected item types have 0 weight. If you select this option, then you will be prompted in a second screen which item types to include.
[*][b]Simpler Armor Sorting[/b]: This simplifies "Armor" and "Clothes" categories in to just "Armor". This is because it is often hard to automatically distinguish between the two and items risk being mis-categorized (like a hat being labelled as armor).
[*][b]Use Scrap Item Component Tags[/b]: This adds additional text replacement tags to the end of SCRAP items. If using HUDFramework and DEF_HUD, these text tags are hidden but will be displayed as a list of components when you mouse-over on scrap items in the world.
[*][b]0.8+ | Skip Armo/Weap Patching: [/b]This bypasses any WEAP/ARMO/INNR/LVLI patching for those who wish to use another sorting mod like VIS to handle weapon and armors. See the sticky in the POSTS section on this mod page for more information.
[*][b]0.8+ | Value:Weight Ratio:[/b] Simple Sorter adds a [Valuable] tag to your scrap/junk misc items that have a value:weight ratio of 50 or more (items with less than 1 weight are treated as 1). You can now set this ratio to whatever you want. NOTE: If you use the Weightless options, the value:Weight ratio will be applied afterward so all items will be treated as if they were weight 1.
[/list]
[color=#d8d8d8]4. Select "New Patch" if this is your first time running the script OR if you want to nuke the old patch and start fresh.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]If prompted for a name, you can name it whatever you want (Just don't change the Author Name in the plugins File Header).[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]VERY IMPORTANT: Patching takes time, BE PATIENT. Report any patch times in excess of 15 mins.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]FO4Edit has a tendency to "freeze" and show as not responding, this is normal, just leave it, go make a coffee, and wait it out.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]When the patcher is done you will get a popup message saying "Patching Complete". [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]I have included an Amend button that lets you run the patch for newly added items to your mod list without messing with the items already patched. However, it doesn't always work well, especially on larger load orders. When possible, you are better off selecting NEW PATCH, though doing this WILL nuke the old patch items, so you will lose any manual edits you made to the patch.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]5. When you are done, it is suggested to have a quick look through the new patch plugin and look for any miscategorised items and make any manual edits if you are comfortable with FO4Edit. If you are finding items that are wildly miscategorised, or entire mods that get put in the wrong categories, please let me know and I will decide whether its feasible to alter the script or not.
[/color][color=#efefef]NOTE: For 0.8+ users using the BAT file to patch, you will not be able to inspect the plugin after patching. Instead you will have to close FO4Edit, then reopen it the normal way and be sure to select your patch in the plugin selection menu.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]6. Close FO4Edit, upon doing so you will receive a popup box, make sure your new plugin is selected and continue exiting. Your plugin will now be saved. Again, FO4Edit can freeze up at this point as it is writing a lot of data, give it a few mins to close completely. [/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]7. Load up your mod manager, make sure the new patch ESP is located AT THE BOTTOM of your load order, no exceptions, and remember to activate the ESP in your mod manager.[/color]


[color=#d8d8d8]That should be all there is to it. These steps are quite detailed, and make it seem like a huge task to patch your game but its actually very simple to do, I just like to be thorough.[/color]


[color=#d5a6bd][b]NOTES:[/b][/color]
[list]
[*]Do not re-run the patch in the same session of FO4Edit, always resart FO4Edit before re-running the script a second time. There is a GUI glitch that sometimes occurs where your new plugin disappears from the list. It is still there it just doesnt display.
You will still be prompted to save it on closing but its better to avoid the bug anyway.[*]Do not change the AUTHOR name on your newly made plugin, the script uses this to determine if an existing patch has been made. You can change the actual NAME of the plugin though.
[*]INNR Dynamic Naming patching is incredibly difficult to get right, as there is numerous ways an item can be renamed. In some cases, the script may not catch every item so you might see cases where an item doesnt have an icon. If this happens, report it to me so I can investigate, in the meantime you can rename items at workbenches, DEFUI will still use any valid text replacement tags this way. See below for a list of all the text tags used.
[*]Patching takes time, for me it takes about 15 mins to run on a mod list of about 210 plugins, it all depends on the size of your mod lists and what sort of items you have in your game. BE PATIENT.
FO4Edit has a tendency to "freeze" and show as not responding, this is normal, just leave it, go make a coffee, and wait it out. When the patcher is done you will get a popup message saying "Patching Complete". [/list]
[i][b]
This mod has a LOT of moving parts under the hood, that it would take too long to explain every little detail. That said, It is all stuff that is happening outside of the game so there is effectively no performance hit.[/b][/i]

[b][color=#d5a6bd]CATEGORIES:[/color]
[/b][color=#d8d8d8]These are the categories/tags used by this mod. You can rename weapons and armor and still type the relevant text tag and DEFUI will [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]still use the relevant icon.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8][Aid][/color]

[b][color=#d5a6bd]CREDITS:[/color]
[/b][color=#d8d8d8][b]MatorTheEternal [/b]- [/color][i]For MXPF and helping me throughout my entire modding life so far.[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8][b]Zilav [/b]- [/color][i]For helping with several scripting roadblocks.[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8][b]Neeanka [/b]- [/color][i]For DEFUI.[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8][b]Valdacil [/b]- [/color][i]For VIS and all his work on the various other tools.[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8]The lads from Gambit's discord server - [/color][i]helping me organise categories and explaining some finer points of DEFUI).[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8][b]Pra [/b]- [/color][i]For his Visify scripts that perform similar functions. Was able to work out some missing categorisation ideas from his 
scripts.
  [/i]
[color=#d8d8d8] [/color][i][b] Many others from many discords, too many to name.[/b][/i]

modInfo.author: Ruddy88
modInfo.description:
[color=#d5a6bd][size=6][b][u]Ruddy88 Simple Sorter[/u][/b][/size][/color]


[color=#d5a6bd][size=2][b]VERSION HISTORY:
[/b][/size][/color][color=#d8d8d8][size=2][i]See Changelog tab for detailed info
[/i]
[font=Arial][i]0.5 BETA - Initial public release
0.6 BETA - Blank Name bug fix and various improvements (XML and SCRIPT)
0.7 BETA - Critical bug fixes. All reported major bugs now resolved.
0.8 BETA - Added a "Skip WEAP/ARMO" option. Added a new category to Weightless Options for MISC (Mods Only). Added a BAT file to the FO4Edit directory for more convenient patching. (See POSTS section for 0.8 Patch Notes).
0.81 BETA - Script file hotfix to remove component tags from Valuables and other non scrap tagged items.
Updated DEF_INV_TABS.xml to better categorise Barter and Trade menus.[/i][/font][/size]
[size=2]
[/size][/color]
[size=2][color=#d5a6bd][b]DISCLAIMER:[/b]
[/color][color=#d8d8d8]This mod does not install or run like typical mods. As such, I have included a very extensive set of instructions. Do not let it scare you off, this mod is very simple to use for what it does. But please, ensure you read through each section before you report any issues. I know, walls of text suck, but it's necessary for mods like this. Just read it.[/color]

[color=#d5a6bd][b]INTRODUCTION:[/b]
[/color][color=#d8d8d8]Welcome to Ruddy88's Simple Sorter.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]This is an XEdit script that allows users to AUTOMATICALLY patch their entire load order for use with DEFUI's icon tag replacement feature.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]For those that dont know what that means, DEFUI is a mod that uses text replacement to add icons to items. There is also an added benefit of the text replacement still being used in alphabetical sorting so you get better categorisation of items making navigating your pipboy much easier.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]If that still doesnt make sense: It adds icons to inventory items and allows for better sorting.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]Traditionally though, for mods to utilise DEFUIs icons, you would need countless patches to add the required text tag to the item names.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]This is where Simple Sorter comes in.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Simple Sorter is a FO4Edit script that will automatically add the text needed for icon replacements for all valid items in your entire load order. It automatically scans your mod list, loads all valid items to a new ESP, then detects what sort of item it is so that the correct icons are used.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]This means NO MORE endless patches and NO MORE spending hours of manually editing mods. There's a few steps to get it started, but after that its a simple process of just running the script to generate a patch.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]I have also included some item rollups to further clean up your pipboy menus. Virtually every item has been split in to sub groups that are accessed via the pipboy. EG: Your weapons tab wont be full of all sorts of weapons, instead it will display Melee, Ranged and Explosives. You can click on any of these to see all the relevant weapons of that type rather than have all 3 types on one page.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]A final note, I have added as many "safety" features as I can to this mod. This mod is to be used INSTEAD of things like VIS or VIS-G, so you shouldnt have those mods installed, however, for those that are lazy, you dont necessarily have to remove all your old VIS versions of mods, as this mods script will REMOVE any tags before adding new ones.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]The exception to this is INNRs, but I am working on a way to effectively clean them up a bit.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Either way, uninstall VIS or VIS-G prior to using this mod but dont worry too much about VIS versions of other mods. [/color]


[color=#d5a6bd][b]REQUIREMENTS:[/b]
[/color][i]The following mods are a hard requirement.
DO NOT try and install all of these with a mod manager, many will require manual installation (See INSTALLING REQUIRED FILES).
[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8]FO4Edit  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737/]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737/[/url]
[color=#d8d8d8]MXPF  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68617/]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68617/[/url][color=#d8d8d8]  (Yes, this is a Skyrim mod, it works on FO4)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]DefUI  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10654]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10654[/url]
[color=#d8d8d8]DEF_UI Iconlibs Rescaled and Fixed  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/31088/]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/31088/[/url][color=#d8d8d8]  (Colored or Monotone, your choice).[/color]

[u]OPTIONAL
[/u][color=#d8d8d8]HUDFramework  -  https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/20309/  (If using the additional component tags)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]AKWCR  -  https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6091/  (If using the AWKCR workbench patcher)[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]3. In the first dialogue box, you will be presented with some options:[/color]

[list]
[*][b]Run AWKCR Workbench Patcher[/b]: This will detect any item recipes that use the CHEMS workbench, if the created item is a weapon, armor, ammo, or explosive, then it will instead be added to the appropriate AWKCR workbench under the "Other" category.
[*][b]Weightless Items[/b]: This will make all selected item types have 0 weight. If you select this option, then you will be prompted in a second screen which item types to include.
[*][b]Simpler Armor Sorting[/b]: This simplifies "Armor" and "Clothes" categories in to just "Armor". This is because it is often hard to automatically distinguish between the two and items risk being mis-categorized (like a hat being labelled as armor).
[*][b]Use Scrap Item Component Tags[/b]: This adds additional text replacement tags to the end of SCRAP items. If using HUDFramework and DEF_HUD, these text tags are hidden but will be displayed as a list of components when you mouse-over on scrap items in the world.
[*][b]0.8+ | Skip Armo/Weap Patching: [/b]This bypasses any WEAP/ARMO/INNR/LVLI patching for those who wish to use another sorting mod like VIS to handle weapon and armors. See the sticky in the POSTS section on this mod page for more information.
[*][b]0.8+ | Value:Weight Ratio:[/b] Simple Sorter adds a [Valuable] tag to your scrap/junk misc items that have a value:weight ratio of 50 or more (items with less than 1 weight are treated as 1). You can now set this ratio to whatever you want. NOTE: If you use the Weightless options, the value:Weight ratio will be applied afterward so all items will be treated as if they were weight 1.
[/list]
[color=#d8d8d8]4. Select "New Patch" if this is your first time running the script OR if you want to nuke the old patch and start fresh.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]If prompted for a name, you can name it whatever you want (Just don't change the Author Name in the plugins File Header).[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]VERY IMPORTANT: Patching takes time, BE PATIENT. Report any patch times in excess of 15 mins.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]FO4Edit has a tendency to "freeze" and show as not responding, this is normal, just leave it, go make a coffee, and wait it out.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]When the patcher is done you will get a popup message saying "Patching Complete". [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]I have included an Amend button that lets you run the patch for newly added items to your mod list without messing with the items already patched. However, it doesn't always work well, especially on larger load orders. When possible, you are better off selecting NEW PATCH, though doing this WILL nuke the old patch items, so you will lose any manual edits you made to the patch.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]5. When you are done, it is suggested to have a quick look through the new patch plugin and look for any miscategorised items and make any manual edits if you are comfortable with FO4Edit. If you are finding items that are wildly miscategorised, or entire mods that get put in the wrong categories, please let me know and I will decide whether its feasible to alter the script or not.
[/color][color=#efefef]NOTE: For 0.8+ users using the BAT file to patch, you will not be able to inspect the plugin after patching. Instead you will have to close FO4Edit, then reopen it the normal way and be sure to select your patch in the plugin selection menu.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]6. Close FO4Edit, upon doing so you will receive a popup box, make sure your new plugin is selected and continue exiting. Your plugin will now be saved. Again, FO4Edit can freeze up at this point as it is writing a lot of data, give it a few mins to close completely. [/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]7. Load up your mod manager, make sure the new patch ESP is located AT THE BOTTOM of your load order, no exceptions, and remember to activate the ESP in your mod manager.[/color]


[color=#d8d8d8]That should be all there is to it. These steps are quite detailed, and make it seem like a huge task to patch your game but its actually very simple to do, I just like to be thorough.[/color]


[color=#d5a6bd][b]NOTES:[/b][/color]
[list]
[*]Do not re-run the patch in the same session of FO4Edit, always resart FO4Edit before re-running the script a second time. There is a GUI glitch that sometimes occurs where your new plugin disappears from the list. It is still there it just doesnt display.
You will still be prompted to save it on closing but its better to avoid the bug anyway.[*]Do not change the AUTHOR name on your newly made plugin, the script uses this to determine if an existing patch has been made. You can change the actual NAME of the plugin though.
[*]INNR Dynamic Naming patching is incredibly difficult to get right, as there is numerous ways an item can be renamed. In some cases, the script may not catch every item so you might see cases where an item doesnt have an icon. If this happens, report it to me so I can investigate, in the meantime you can rename items at workbenches, DEFUI will still use any valid text replacement tags this way. See below for a list of all the text tags used.
[*]Patching takes time, for me it takes about 15 mins to run on a mod list of about 210 plugins, it all depends on the size of your mod lists and what sort of items you have in your game. BE PATIENT.
FO4Edit has a tendency to "freeze" and show as not responding, this is normal, just leave it, go make a coffee, and wait it out. When the patcher is done you will get a popup message saying "Patching Complete". [/list]
[i][b]
This mod has a LOT of moving parts under the hood, that it would take too long to explain every little detail. That said, It is all stuff that is happening outside of the game so there is effectively no performance hit.[/b][/i]

[color=#d8d8d8]still use the relevant icon.[/color]

modInfo.name: Ruddy88's Simple Sorter
modInfo.summary: Simple Sorter is a FO4Edit script that will automatically add the text needed for icon replacements for all valid items in your entire load order. It automatically scans your mod list, loads all valid items to a new ESP, then detects what sort of item it is so that the correct icons are used. No more patches, no more manually patching.

[color=#d5a6bd][size=6][b][u]Ruddy88 Simple Sorter[/u][/b][/size][/color]


[color=#d5a6bd][size=2][b]VERSION HISTORY:
[/b][/size][/color][color=#d8d8d8][size=2][i]See Changelog tab for detailed info
[/i]
[font=Arial][i]0.5 BETA - Initial public release
0.6 BETA - Blank Name bug fix and various improvements (XML and SCRIPT)
0.7 BETA - Critical bug fixes. All reported major bugs now resolved.
0.8 BETA - Added a "Skip WEAP/ARMO" option. Added a new category to Weightless Options for MISC (Mods Only). Added a BAT file to the FO4Edit directory for more convenient patching. (See POSTS section for 0.8 Patch Notes).
0.81 BETA - Script file hotfix to remove component tags from Valuables and other non scrap tagged items.
Updated DEF_INV_TABS.xml to better categorise Barter and Trade menus.[/i][/font][/size]
[size=2]
[/size][/color]
[size=2][color=#d5a6bd][b]DISCLAIMER:[/b]
[/color][color=#d8d8d8]This mod does not install or run like typical mods. As such, I have included a very extensive set of instructions. Do not let it scare you off, this mod is very simple to use for what it does. But please, ensure you read through each section before you report any issues. I know, walls of text suck, but it's necessary for mods like this. Just read it.[/color]

[color=#d5a6bd][b]INTRODUCTION:[/b]
[/color][color=#d8d8d8]Welcome to Ruddy88's Simple Sorter.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]This is an XEdit script that allows users to AUTOMATICALLY patch their entire load order for use with DEFUI's icon tag replacement feature.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]For those that dont know what that means, DEFUI is a mod that uses text replacement to add icons to items. There is also an added benefit of the text replacement still being used in alphabetical sorting so you get better categorisation of items making navigating your pipboy much easier.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]If that still doesnt make sense: It adds icons to inventory items and allows for better sorting.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]Traditionally though, for mods to utilise DEFUIs icons, you would need countless patches to add the required text tag to the item names.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]This is where Simple Sorter comes in.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Simple Sorter is a FO4Edit script that will automatically add the text needed for icon replacements for all valid items in your entire load order. It automatically scans your mod list, loads all valid items to a new ESP, then detects what sort of item it is so that the correct icons are used.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]This means NO MORE endless patches and NO MORE spending hours of manually editing mods. There's a few steps to get it started, but after that its a simple process of just running the script to generate a patch.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]I have also included some item rollups to further clean up your pipboy menus. Virtually every item has been split in to sub groups that are accessed via the pipboy. EG: Your weapons tab wont be full of all sorts of weapons, instead it will display Melee, Ranged and Explosives. You can click on any of these to see all the relevant weapons of that type rather than have all 3 types on one page.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]A final note, I have added as many "safety" features as I can to this mod. This mod is to be used INSTEAD of things like VIS or VIS-G, so you shouldnt have those mods installed, however, for those that are lazy, you dont necessarily have to remove all your old VIS versions of mods, as this mods script will REMOVE any tags before adding new ones.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]The exception to this is INNRs, but I am working on a way to effectively clean them up a bit.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Either way, uninstall VIS or VIS-G prior to using this mod but dont worry too much about VIS versions of other mods. [/color]


[color=#d5a6bd][b]REQUIREMENTS:[/b]
[/color][i]The following mods are a hard requirement.
DO NOT try and install all of these with a mod manager, many will require manual installation (See INSTALLING REQUIRED FILES).
[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8]FO4Edit  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737/]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/2737/[/url]
[color=#d8d8d8]MXPF  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68617/]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68617/[/url][color=#d8d8d8]  (Yes, this is a Skyrim mod, it works on FO4)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]DefUI  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10654]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/10654[/url]
[color=#d8d8d8]DEF_UI Iconlibs Rescaled and Fixed  -  [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/31088/]https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/31088/[/url][color=#d8d8d8]  (Colored or Monotone, your choice).[/color]

[u]OPTIONAL
[/u][color=#d8d8d8]HUDFramework  -  https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/20309/  (If using the additional component tags)[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]AKWCR  -  https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6091/  (If using the AWKCR workbench patcher)[/color]


[b][color=#d5a6bd]SHORT VERSION:
[/color][/b][color=#d8d8d8]Below this section is a very in depth guide on how to set this mod up. [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]For those who are a little more comfortable with Patching takes time, for me it takes about 15 mins to run on a mod list of about [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]210 plugins, it all depends on the size of you scripts, here's a very vague rundown.[/color]

[list]
[*]﻿Install all required mods, make sure MXPF and R88SimpleSorter_SCRIPT are both extracted to your FO4Edit directory.
[*]﻿Run FO4Edit, ﻿during plugin selection, leave it as default (loads with all curently active plugins). Hold SHIFT when hitting OK to load the progam faster.
[*]When loaded, right click any plugin from the left hand panel, select Apply Script, navigate to R88_SimpleSorter and hit OK.
[*]Select your options from the popup dialogue box, mouse-over for tool tips for more explanation.
[*]Select NEW Patch to generate a patch for the first time or to "nuke" your old patch and start over.
[*]Select "Amend" to re-run the patch but only patch in newly added records (This doesn't always work well, Suggest running a new patch each time).
[*]Name the new plugin whatever you want, just dont ever change the author name in the header.
[*]When finished, make any manual tweaks, close FO4Edit to save your new plugin.
[*]Remember to activate the new plugin in your mod manager.
[/list]

[color=#d8d8d8]For those wanting a more in depth guide, keep reading.[/color]


[b][color=#d5a6bd]INSTALLING REQUIRED FILES:[/color]
[/b][/size]1. Download FO4Edit manually, extract contents to a directory of your choice.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]2. Download MXPF manually (it is hosted on Skyrim Nexus), extract contents to your FO4Edit directory, ensuring the 'Edit Scripts' folder aligns with      the one in FO4Edit.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]3. Download my R88SimpleSorter_SCRIPT file manually, as above, extract to FO4Edit directory ensuring Edit Scripts folders line up.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]4. Download DEFUI, both main files. Users who have already installed DEFUI will not need to reinstall it providing they chose both DEF_INV during      their installation. You can reinstall it if you wish to choose different options.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]5. Install with Mod Manager of your choice with the following options:[font=Verdana][size=2][b]
[/b] ﻿ ﻿a. Select both DEF_INV and DEF_HUD.
﻿ ﻿b. Select a language and a screen ratio.
﻿ ﻿c. OPTIONAL: Select "Use Sorting Mod Component Tags" (requires HUDFramework).
﻿d. ﻿Select "Vanilla HUD".
﻿ e. Choose to include basic XML files (this is just to fill in any missing files that my mod doesnt include).
[/size][/font]6. When you are done with the first file, install the second file (translations), Delete the Translate_xx.txt file from Fallout 4\Data\Interface folder.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]7. Downlaod and install DEF_UI Iconlibs Rescaled and Fixed with a mod manager of your choice. Let it overwrite.[font=Verdana][size=2]
[/size][/font]8. Download and install my R88SimpleSorter_XML file with a mod manager of your choice. Let it overwrite.[font=Verdana][size=2]


[i]OPTIONAL[/i][color=#d8d8d8]: If you chose "Use Sorting Components" when installing DEFUI, then you will also want to download and install HUDFramework using a mod manager of your choice.[/color]

[i]OPTIONAL[/i][color=#d8d8d8]: Download and install my R88SimpleSorter_INNR with a mod manager of your choice, This ESP should be last in your load order prior to running the script (next section).[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]This is a simple esp that re-orders the vanilla dynamic naming records. It DOES NOT add any text tags for icon replacement, that is all handled via the script in the next section. You can choose to use my INNR format, or stick with the vanilla ones. You CAN use other mods INNRs if you wish, but you may end up with double text tags in some cases.[/color]


[b][color=#d5a6bd]PATCHING:
[/color][/b][i]NOTE: Patching takes time, expect anywhere between 5-30 mins for it to run, depending on how extensive your mod list is.
It is also strongly suggested to sort the rest of your mod list before attempting to patch, so get any smashed/bashed patches, merged plugins and load order all sorted before running the script.

0.8+ Users:
I have now included a BAT file in the main SCRIPT archive.
Simply navigate to your FO4Edit directory and double click the R88SimpleSorter.BAT file.
This will auto-run FO4Edit with your currently active mods and will auto run the Simple Sorter patch for you. 
You will still be prompted with the same patch options. You can now skip to step 3 to read more about them.
Also remember to activate your new plugin in your mod manager when you are done.
[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8]1. Open FO4Edit, a dialogue window will display all your plugins. Click OK, this will load the program with all your currently active plugins pre-selected. [/color][i]NOTE: Hold shift for a few seconds as you press OK, this does a faster load of the program.[/i]
[color=#d8d8d8]When the message window shows: Background Loader: finished, the program has fully loaded.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]2. In the left hand panel, right click any of the listed plugins, select "Apply Script".[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Navigate to R88_SimpleSorter. [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]DO NOT edit the text box. Simply click OK to run the script.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]3. In the first dialogue box, you will be presented with some options:[/color]

[list]
[*][b]Run AWKCR Workbench Patcher[/b]: This will detect any item recipes that use the CHEMS workbench, if the created item is a weapon, armor, ammo, or explosive, then it will instead be added to the appropriate AWKCR workbench under the "Other" category.
[*][b]Weightless Items[/b]: This will make all selected item types have 0 weight. If you select this option, then you will be prompted in a second screen which item types to include.
[*][b]Simpler Armor Sorting[/b]: This simplifies "Armor" and "Clothes" categories in to just "Armor". This is because it is often hard to automatically distinguish between the two and items risk being mis-categorized (like a hat being labelled as armor).
[*][b]Use Scrap Item Component Tags[/b]: This adds additional text replacement tags to the end of SCRAP items. If using HUDFramework and DEF_HUD, these text tags are hidden but will be displayed as a list of components when you mouse-over on scrap items in the world.
[*][b]0.8+ | Skip Armo/Weap Patching: [/b]This bypasses any WEAP/ARMO/INNR/LVLI patching for those who wish to use another sorting mod like VIS to handle weapon and armors. See the sticky in the POSTS section on this mod page for more information.
[*][b]0.8+ | Value:Weight Ratio:[/b] Simple Sorter adds a [Valuable] tag to your scrap/junk misc items that have a value:weight ratio of 50 or more (items with less than 1 weight are treated as 1). You can now set this ratio to whatever you want. NOTE: If you use the Weightless options, the value:Weight ratio will be applied afterward so all items will be treated as if they were weight 1.
[/list]
[color=#d8d8d8]4. Select "New Patch" if this is your first time running the script OR if you want to nuke the old patch and start fresh.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]If prompted for a name, you can name it whatever you want (Just don't change the Author Name in the plugins File Header).[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]VERY IMPORTANT: Patching takes time, BE PATIENT. Report any patch times in excess of 15 mins.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]FO4Edit has a tendency to "freeze" and show as not responding, this is normal, just leave it, go make a coffee, and wait it out.[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]When the patcher is done you will get a popup message saying "Patching Complete". [/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]I have included an Amend button that lets you run the patch for newly added items to your mod list without messing with the items already patched. However, it doesn't always work well, especially on larger load orders. When possible, you are better off selecting NEW PATCH, though doing this WILL nuke the old patch items, so you will lose any manual edits you made to the patch.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]5. When you are done, it is suggested to have a quick look through the new patch plugin and look for any miscategorised items and make any manual edits if you are comfortable with FO4Edit. If you are finding items that are wildly miscategorised, or entire mods that get put in the wrong categories, please let me know and I will decide whether its feasible to alter the script or not.
[/color][color=#efefef]NOTE: For 0.8+ users using the BAT file to patch, you will not be able to inspect the plugin after patching. Instead you will have to close FO4Edit, then reopen it the normal way and be sure to select your patch in the plugin selection menu.[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]6. Close FO4Edit, upon doing so you will receive a popup box, make sure your new plugin is selected and continue exiting. Your plugin will now be saved. Again, FO4Edit can freeze up at this point as it is writing a lot of data, give it a few mins to close completely. [/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]7. Load up your mod manager, make sure the new patch ESP is located AT THE BOTTOM of your load order, no exceptions, and remember to activate the ESP in your mod manager.[/color]


[color=#d8d8d8]That should be all there is to it. These steps are quite detailed, and make it seem like a huge task to patch your game but its actually very simple to do, I just like to be thorough.[/color]


[color=#d5a6bd][b]NOTES:[/b][/color]
[list]
[*]Do not re-run the patch in the same session of FO4Edit, always resart FO4Edit before re-running the script a second time. There is a GUI glitch that sometimes occurs where your new plugin disappears from the list. It is still there it just doesnt display.
You will still be prompted to save it on closing but its better to avoid the bug anyway.[*]Do not change the AUTHOR name on your newly made plugin, the script uses this to determine if an existing patch has been made. You can change the actual NAME of the plugin though.
[*]INNR Dynamic Naming patching is incredibly difficult to get right, as there is numerous ways an item can be renamed. In some cases, the script may not catch every item so you might see cases where an item doesnt have an icon. If this happens, report it to me so I can investigate, in the meantime you can rename items at workbenches, DEFUI will still use any valid text replacement tags this way. See below for a list of all the text tags used.
[*]Patching takes time, for me it takes about 15 mins to run on a mod list of about 210 plugins, it all depends on the size of your mod lists and what sort of items you have in your game. BE PATIENT.
FO4Edit has a tendency to "freeze" and show as not responding, this is normal, just leave it, go make a coffee, and wait it out. When the patcher is done you will get a popup message saying "Patching Complete". [/list]
[i][b]
This mod has a LOT of moving parts under the hood, that it would take too long to explain every little detail. That said, It is all stuff that is happening outside of the game so there is effectively no performance hit.[/b][/i]

[b][color=#d5a6bd]CATEGORIES:[/color]
[/b][color=#d8d8d8]These are the categories/tags used by this mod. You can rename weapons and armor and still type the relevant text tag and DEFUI will [/color]

modInfo.name: Ruddy88's Simple Sorter
modInfo.summary: Simple Sorter is a FO4Edit script that will automatically add the text needed for icon replacements for all valid items in your entire load order. It automatically scans your mod list, loads all valid items to a new ESP, then detects what sort of item it is so that the correct icons are used. No more patches, no more manually patching.

details.description:
[size=2][img]http://i.imgur.com/wZAuE2E.png[/img]

[/size]
[size=3]YOUTUBE[/size]: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtKvZZiXGzDdCrHbQVk7u0Q



[color=#ff0000][size=5][img]http://i.imgur.com/6U1eUl1.png[/img][/size][/color]

[size=4]NOT COMPATIBLE[/size]: All of my other deadly mods this mod compensates for all of them


[size=4]COMPATIBLE[/size] with everything else (I don't know about mods that alter leveled lists)

[img]http://i.imgur.com/ZWln7FE.png[/img][color=#ffff00]
[/color][size=2]Version 2: Fixed Vertibird falling through the floor, Given Palmers Gunship Gauss Cannons.

Version 3: Buffed: Child of the Glow

Buffed: Captain Hannes 

Buffed: Palmer's Gunship

Nerfed: General Guthrie's Weapon

Version 4: Added 2 new helmets and 1 new armor set
[/size]

[size=5][color=#00ff00]DESCRIPTION[/color]
[/size]

This mod overhauls every major enemy faction in fallout 4 ( Raiders, Gunners, Super Mutants. Ghouls, Children of Atom)

With new variants, weapons, bosses, armor, repopulation and AI changes

[size=3]FEATURES:

[youtube]lXWYK7vuiyc[/youtube]

New Npc varients[/size]

[size=3]Several New Voice acted Bosses[/size]

[size=3]Unique weapons and armor for those bosses[/size]

[size=3]Unique npc's[/size]

[size=3]Example: Gunner Medic (Heals Nearby allies occasionally) 

Raider Boomer (Runs up to player and blows up when health is low)
[/size]
[size=3]New encounters between factions (Small faction battles randomly occur) 


[/size][size=5][color=#00ff00]BOSS LOCATIONS[/color]: For video reviews [/size][size=3](Any high quality video review will be posted on this page)

[img]http://i.imgur.com/fxly0T4.png[/img][/size]

RAIDERS:

Warchief Mcgregor: Andrew Station

Brookshire the Boulder: East City Downs

Flesh eater Nathaniel: Corvega Assembly Plant

Brick: FMS North Star

Bearspawn Bradley: D.B Tech High

GUNNERS:

General Guthrie: Quincy

Captain Hannes: Quincy

Colonel Crocket: Gunners Plaza

Eli "The Revolver": Hub City

Commander Palmer: Mike Pass Interchange

Feral Ghouls:

Project X-259F - Wildwood Cemetery

Super Mutants:

Leather Skin: Coast Guard Pier

Behemoth Titan: Coast Guard Pier

Children of Atom:

Child of the Glow: Crater House

Ungodly Mozgus: Union Hope Cathedral

The Grand Inquisitor: Federal Ration Stockpile Church


Don't forget to leave an Endorsement :)

details.author: Blaze69
details.description:
[center][size=6][b][font=Trebuchet MS][color=#00ff00][u]Gunner Outfit Pack - CBBE Patch[/u][/color][/font][/b][/size][/center]

[size=4][b][center][color=#ff0000][u]IMPORTANT NOTICE:[/u][/color] this patch has not been updated for v4.0+ of the Gunner Outfit Pack yet. As a result, trying to load this with the v4.0 file will result in mismatched meshes and missing textures for certain outfit pieces edited or removed from the outfits between v3.0 and v4.0.

I cannot promise this mod will be updated anytime soon, if ever, but it's likely it will happen at some point (hopefully sooner rather than later). Stay tuned.

In the meantime, the patch should still work fine with v3.0 (available on the "Older Files" section of the main mod's download page) should you prefer CBBE compatibility over the new stuff added in v4.0.[/center][/b][/size]

[b][color=#ffa500][font=Tahoma, sans-serif][size=4]Description:[/size][/font][/color][/b]

This small mod patches the female outfit meshes from DefaltTheFixer's [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/43686]Gunner Outfit Pack[/url] to be compatible with CBBE bodies and textures and avoid texture bugs. Also fixes some minor issues with equipment slots that caused visual glitches.

Note that [b]this mod does [color=#ff0000][u]NOT[/u][/color] include Bodyslide files[/b], it simply replaces the (vanilla) female body meshes in the outfits with vanilla-shaped CBBE-compatible ones. Outfit/body shape is largely unchanged other than minor tweaks to prevent clipping in certain areas.

[b][color=#ffa500][font=Tahoma, sans-serif][size=4]Notes:[/size][/font][/color][/b]

--- The original meshes are all edits or mashups of vanilla outfits and thus are [i]extremely[/i] low-poly (Beth really dropped the ball there). No blatant clipping or mesh distortion/stretching was observed in the edited meshes here, but it may happen.

--- The download includes a small plugin patch to solve the slot data issues as well as a BA2 archive with the edited meshes.
﻿\---> The mod will work fine by simply placing the patch below the original mod in the load order, but more advanced users may want to merge the ﻿ ﻿﻿changes into the original plugin and extract and repack the patched meshes into the original mod's BA2.

[b][color=#ffa500][font=Tahoma, sans-serif][size=4]Requirements:[/size][/font][/color][/b]

[b][size=3]--- [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/43686]Gunner Outfit Pack (STANDALONE)[/url][/size][/b]
[b][size=3]--- [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/15]Caliente's Beautiful Bodies Enhancer -CBBE-[/url][/size][/b]
Or any other female body replacer using CBBE-compatible textures.

[b][color=#ffa500][size=4]Changelog:[/size][/color][/b]

[b]V1.0[/b]
--- Initial Release

[b][color=#ffa500][size=4]Credits and Thanks:[/size][/color][/b]

ASlySpyDuo for the screenshots.

Note: according to permissions, everything here should be fine, but if any author wants me to remove their assets from this file for some reason or to edit the credit section, just let me know and I will comply as soon as possible.

[color=#ff0000][size=3][b]NONE OF MY ASSETS CAN BE USED IN MODS AVAILABLE FOR SALE OR OTHERWISE REQUIRING PAYMENT IN ORDER TO BE ACCESSED. EVER![/b][/size][/color]
